boardgame.name: Wordl3s
boardgame.description:
Wordl3s is a word deduction game for two players. Guess the secret three-letter word of your opponent within 12 attempts using a combined process of deduction and elimination.
On each turn, a player will:
1. Optionally flip a new word card
2. Pick a word to use for a question
3. Write it down on their form
4. Ask the opponent a question
5. Record the answer.

The game ends when both players have guessed each others’ words. A player cannot exceed 12 attempts at filling out their form, in which case gets no score.

boardgame.name: Rackare! 2
boardgame.description: This box expands Rackare with 600 new cards, 200 white and 400 black. The expansion can be played alone without the main game. The mechanic is just the same as Cards Against Humanity where you fill in blanks with words or sentences from the cards you have at hand.

boardgame.name: Amerique 1500
boardgame.description:
We are in 1500, at a time when Europeans had not yet settled in America. A great fair is in preparation among all peoples.

In Amerique 1500, players compete to be the first to complete 3 tasks. On their turn, the player begins by rolling the nature die which will give an advantage to all players or only to the active player. Then, he will have to choose an action among these four: explore his territory (draw cards), barter (exchange resources), manufacture items (engine building) or play cards (to collect resources).

Versions
There are two ways to play Amerique 1500: the QUICK game and the FULL game. For a first game, it is recommended to play the fast version if children 10 and under play it.

boardgame.name: Rackare! 3
boardgame.description: Expands the base game with another 600 600 new cards that deal with everything from pandemics to electric scooters. 400 white cards and 200 black cards. Though this expansion can be played as it is without the base game.

boardgame.name: Rackarunge
boardgame.description:
Rackarunge is a simple game, to the point where the rules are impossible to misunderstand: Each round a player puts down a yellow card and the other players fill in their best pink cards. The one who put down the yellow card decide which the funniest combination. First to ten points wins the game and earns the title of being a real "Rackarunge".

This is a Swedish adaptation (cultural references as well as language) of Cards Against Humanity. Specifically, this is aimed to be suitable for a younger audience.

boardgame.name: Aelderman
boardgame.description:
Join us on a journey to the Middle Ages - a time when emerging trading cities became important influential factors in the political game for power and wealth. Originating in Luebeck, the Hanseatic Trade League is formed, long-distance traders join forces and thereby create unprecedented wealth in northern Europe. There are many opportunities for young merchants to gain power and influence. Nevertheless, only few have the chance to be elected to the most influential position and thus lead the Hanseatic Trade League as Aelderman.

Aelderman is a competitive Euro-Game for 2-4 players. You embody an ambitious merchant in the medieval Hanseatic League and fight for your place at the top of the trade alliance!
Through lucrative trading with other Hanseatic cities, you increase your wealth and gain more and more influence in the entire region of the North and Baltic Sea. Meanwhile, you contribute to the development of the flourishing city of Luebeck by commissioning useful buildings. Try to secure important privileges during the Hanseatic Convention in the Council Hall before your opponents take them away from you.

Use your limited action points wisely to trade goods and gain wealth. But money alone will not be enough to win this strategic Euro-Game. Rather you must secure as many victory points in the form of council votes as possible through influence majorities on the sea map, your reputation in the city of Luebeck and through various privileges and luxury goods to become Aelderman and win the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Creature Comforts: Talents Micro-Expansion
Dobry Rok: Talenty minidodatek
Die Tiere vom Ahorntal: Berufe
boardgame.description: The Talents Micro-Expansion adds ten unique player powers to Creature Comforts via five double-sided cards. The cards are the same size as the Traveler cards in the base game. Each card is self-explanatory, so once you draft your Talent card, you know all the rules you need to play with your new talent.

boardgame.name: Creature Comforts: Dreams Come True Micro-Expansion
Dobry Rok: Marzenia się spełniają minidodatek
Die Tiere vom Ahorntal: Große Träume
boardgame.description: The Dreams Come True Micro-Expansion provides a deck of twenty-five Dream cards. Each Dream card is a secret goal for you to achieve. You start the game with two Dream cards, but as you fulfill them, you take more. Each Dream card you fulfill provides a few extra points, but they can really add up!

boardgame.name: Toons and Towers
boardgame.description:
Toons And Towers is a card game that is loosely connected to a web comic series. The game involves two players who compete to try to drop their opponent's points to 0 before the end of the agreed time limit. Both players start a game with 80,000 points. Each player will have a deck of 50 cards consisting of cartoon, upgrade, and counter cards.

Both players start the game by drawing five cards from the top of their deck of cards. Each turn is broken into seven steps where players attack and defend aginst each other.

The game ends when one of two things are achieved; a player has been eliminated or the agreed time limit has been reached.

A player wins by successfully attacking his opponent's side of the field until they have reduced their opponent's points down to zero. This can also be achieved by having more remaining points than your opponent by the end of the agreed time limit.

boardgame.name: What Lurks Beneath Tidewatch Tower
boardgame.description:
An entry in the Tenfootpole Waverider keep contest!

From the publishers description:

Despite its benign appearance, Tidewatch Tower has an interesting history.

boardgame.name: The Argent Draconvir
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Argent Draconvir are a powerful dragon-like race, originally from the Chronicles of Aeres 5E setting. This is a version of them built as a demihuman class for Old School-Essentials Advanced Fantasy. They have many strong features, but a slow level progression should balance their power.

boardgame.name: The Old Prince 1871
boardgame.description:
Construction began on the Prince Edward Island Railway (PEIR) in 1871 … the rest is a financial catastrophe. Criticized as the most crooked railway in the world (both physically and financially), Prince Edward Island was nearly at a full economic collapse within a year.

In 1873, Prince Edward Island dumped the PEIR onto Canada and joined the Canadian Federation. The years that followed showed an economic boom for the island and the railroad operated until the 1980s.

This game is not attempting to recreate the history of the island, but borrows its history and geography to explore a new narrative about the island’s Old Prince Edward Island Railway.

boardgame.name: Blessings from His Delicious Corpse
boardgame.description: A supplement for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Onbashira: Log Rider Festival
boardgame.description:
The Onbashira Festival has been held every six years for 1,200 years when the shrine's buildings of Suwa Taisha are rebuilt at Suwa City, Nagano Prefecture, in the Chubu region of Japan. The climax of the festival consists of the Kiotoshi (people riding the gigantic logs as they slide down a steep slope to prove their bravery) In this game you'll build up a crew of Kiotoshi and train them to make sure you have the best odds on surviving the steep slope to prove your bravery as they ride the logs down. Discover ancient survival technics and craft necessary gear that will help you to succeed as the bravest log riding crew for the next six years.

The game is played in multiple phases.

Worker placement phase: On your turn, you'll take 3 actions found around the city, move on around the board to gather resources including recruiting brave new Kiotoshi.

During the Action phase, you'll construct and place your Kiotoshion the logs and push them down the hill to score points.

Scoring phase: Each player will score the necessary points they earned around the board for easy tracking.

The game ends after 5 rounds or the fist player to construct a new tree to symbolize the reunification of nature and the elements. The person who has scored the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Care and Maintenance of the Rookery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A 4-hour Tier 1 adventure in a Feywild Domain of Delight
A lost nature preserve has been rediscovered!

Help its new caretaker secure and restore its once glorious Bastion of Rebirth, so examination of the demiplane can begin.

The Rookery is a magical tome containing a feywild demiplane dedicated to the preservation and rehabilitation of endangered species. The land inside consists of several islands containing diverse habitats such that any creature needing care had terrain similar to home. Once the species recovered or flourished, they were reintroduced to their native plane.

Unfortunately, before the domain truly flourished, the book along with an entire Fey queen’s library was banned and then lost. It was ultimately forgotten, and the land within it left to its own devices for many hundreds of years. As time passed, the original monitoring facilities became a forgotten ruin on a distant island.

It has recently been rediscovered and its new caretaker need assistance rebuilding the former Visitor's Center so he can use it to base his operations out of as he investigates what has happened in the demiplane all the centuries it was neglected.

This is designed as APL 2, but contains adjustment information to run at any level within Tier 1.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Jade Hare
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to Samsara, the Feywild's Domain of Delight, a realm of Rewards, Reincarnation and Fortune.

Inspired by The Myths of the Lunar New Year and the Animals of the Eastern Zodiac.

A mystical whimsy saga in the Domain of Delight, Samsara.

The Usagi clan has been stricken with misfortune and are unable to complete the quest of their patron archfey, The Jade Hare. The clan has hired you and your fellow adventurers; however forces in the shadows wish to sabotage this sacred task and obtain the magical ingredients for their own nefarious purposes.

The Feywild: The Domain of Delight, Samsara.

An adventure for adventurers to reach the magical feywild. The Domain of Delight, Samsara is unique in that it is ruled by thirteen powerful Archfey that share this domain. These Archfey are known as the Zodiac XIII. Explore the Mycelium Forest, The Momiji Mountains, fly to the moon of Chandra and the Moon Palace.

Adventurers will have opportunity to meet one of the archfeys of Samsara, The Jade Hare.

Story 4 of the Zodiac Tales

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Pinepetal's Petty Pilfering
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rest for the night derails into a chase after pilfered belongings when there is an unexpected thief in the night. With only a yellow feather and a set of footprints as a clue, can you recover your lost items?

A Four-Hour romp through a new Domain of Delight for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

CONTENT WARNING: Stealing, implied violence

Adventure Seed: Sticky Little Fingers
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Beneath the New Star
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Newfound knowledge brings you to the domain of Darkon. Alanik is certain Azalin Rex is behind the dark plot, but time is running out to stop them. The detective charges you with venturing to the ruins of Castle Avernus to learn what you can. Hopefully, it isn’t too late.

The thirteenth adventure in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 7th level characters.

CONTENT WARNING:
possible phobia trigger (insects). Mentions torture, gaslighting, murder, nonconsensual reanimation of the dead, and murder of one’s adult child.

boardgame.name: S.P.A.C.E. Force
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The dreaded, and venerable S.P.A.C.E. Force.

There are many things come to mind when you think of them.

Proud. Elite. Insane. Bloodthirsty.

Has an Acronym that nobody, even inside the organization, knows what it stands for.

Made as a genetically and hormonally engineered killing nightmares for waging some long forgotten corporate conquest war ages ago, S.P.A.C.E. Force is an self-isolating, armed and prepped for constant war-type danger that is still operating on old rules and some bent interpretations of morality, and are just the thing your crew of players would love to encounter on their Friday night session of Lawman!

boardgame.name: The Cookie Cadre
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There's nothing worse than a pre-teenager with an temper. Except maybe a pre-teenager with a submachine gun and accidentally supplanted extremist dogma. The Cookie Cadre combines paramilitary action and delicious confectionary delights in a way that is sure to bring more joy and terror to your game table. Be Prepared!

Includes a few adventure seeds to get your crew engaged!

boardgame.name: Lawman Four Fold Vertical DM Screen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Some of youse guys wanted a DM screen.

So I made a DIY printable vertical-oriented, four fold DM screen. Which has shortcuts to everything you need to know for the system, shielded behind a cool logo, in full color or black and white if you don't want to murder your inkjet printer.

boardgame.name: Better Feared: Nosferatu
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Haunts terrify and fascinate the All Night Society in equal measure, yet for all the nightmares they visit upon their Kindred, none compare to the horrors they save for themselves. Now, for the first time in over a decade, return to the rotting underworld of Clan Nosferatu.

Better Feared is a complete guide to the Nosferatu, with updates and expansions to their first edition clan book, The Beast That Haunts the Blood.

boardgame.name: Flik Silverpen's Guide to Dragon Town
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Flik Silverpen’s Guide to Dragon Town is a resource intended to help a Game Master run a group of players through a short low level adventure.

The guide is composed of descriptions, lists, maps and other helpful information about noteworthy people and locations within Dragon Town. It is not a completely comprehensive guide though, so if there is information missing, feel free to fill in the blanks yourself.

boardgame.name: Name's Games 2019 Patreon Exclusive Collection
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

It’s been a full year since we began our Patreon, and in that time, we’ve compiled almost 70 pages of content previews and custom requests from our patrons. This annual collection brings all of that work together in one place for you to enjoy.

Highlights:

9 races such as body-snatching mind worms, cheshire cats, living skeletons, and transforming robots.
8 classes, including arcane tinkerers, forgemasters, magical heroes, martial artists, and pet monster trainers.
Achetypes to play mighty heroes from other planets, champions with specialized tech armor, and whip-wielding protectors against the darkness.
Feats, equipment, magic items, and more!

boardgame.name: Canopy: the Table Top Balancing Game
boardgame.description:
Canopy is a simple balancing game, played with cards.

Players take it in turns to draw a card from the central pile and build out a canopy on top of a stand. The entertainment and jeopardy comes as the canopy grows and gets more unstable.

As the game progresses, the canopy gets wider and wider and more and more unstable until one unlucky player brings the whole thing crashing down.

boardgame.name: Dethrone the Divine
boardgame.description:
From the website:
Here’s how it is: Gods are dicks. They always have been. They ask too much of humans, don’t they? The best livestock, a chunk of your money, and in some cases, a first born child. What do humans get in exchange? A promise that obliteration would not come as long as the offering was paid. As long as the praise was given.

But this doesn't sit right with everyone. Especially when there's grave injustices being carried out in these gods' name. Small or more obscure divine try to gain their own footholds to rewrite the rules themselves.

This is you.

Make your own god, rewrite the rules of the world, remake things in your own image. Build a following and dethrone the divine!

boardgame.name: Dead Reckoning: Custom Sleeves
boardgame.description:
These sleeves are used to make 4 distinct decks. The base game contains sleeves for all the cards but all the card sleeves have the same backs. With these custom sleeves you can sort the decks into the four player decks quickly!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Near Hollow Gods
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
It all ended so suddenly. As their last, swift and mighty act, the Gods saved existence over themselves. Their magic gathered everything and threw it out again, resulting in a chaotic mess of land, sea, and stars. Still, the working stuck, and slowly, over the past decade, souls have returned to living bodies in this new Jumbled Cosmos.

Exploring

Rebuilding

Living

You’re a recently awakened soul who, like everyone else, has lost their memories. You will recover them in time. You will also meet a Cherished One who went before you.

Together you will defeat evil.

Near Hollow Gods is a solo journaling adventure forged with HyveMynd’s Brighthammer rules-light fantasy TTRPG.

boardgame.name: Wódz plemienia
boardgame.description:
Wódz plemienia ("The Tribe Chief") is a very interesting adventure game that will attract everyone. You have to prove that you are the best candidate for Chief of the Tribe.

A true leader must be resourceful, well-planned, charismatic, and committed to trading. Candidates take a test to select who best meets the above criteria. In addition to entrepreneurship and strategic skills, the character and talents assigned to your character are also important. In addition, your village is struggling with the adversities of nature, and fate brings surprises and opportunities that are worth taking advantage of.

THE COURSE OF THE GAME

The game takes place over the course of the year, and the passage of time is the movement of the pawn along the path of time. During each month, all players go through 4 Phases:

PHASE I - GROWTH
In this phase, all players successively: multiply their inventory, take 1 inhabitant, and take the crop from their crops.

PHASE II - TRADE
During this phase, all players buy or sell their 4 inventory tokens. Additionally, whoever has a purchase can go to it and sell tokens there, regardless of the general trade.

PHASE III - CONSTRUCTION
In this phase, players can perform one of the three actions: set up a crop, build a store, or train a buying staff.

PHASE IV - FATE
In this phase, the players roll the dice. Whoever gets an odd number of spots skips fate. Whoever has an even number of spots - he draws the "Fate" card for himself and is used to write it. If having a specific character trait gives you extra prots, it is written on the card and then we follow this notation.

The description of the actions in each phase is additionally written on the board.

After the end of the 4 Phases, we move the time pawn to the next month and start the queue again.

MAGICAL NIGHT
When the movement pawn reaches the MAGIC NIGHT space, we read aloud what happens to the entire village. The record on the card applies to all players. If the holder of a character trait is treated specially, it is recorded on the card.
After following the instructions on the Magic Night card, move the pawn to the next month.

EXCHANGE
If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to pay something to the other, but he does not have the appropriate amount, he returns the inventory tokens to the bank, exchanges them for $ and pays the opponent. If one player has to give the other an inventory token, but he doesn't have one, he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 for 1 inventory). If, as a result of writing on the card, one player has to give the other a citizen token, but he does not have one, then he pays the equivalent of $ ($ 1 per 1 inhabitant).

CORONATION

After the time pawn reaches this space, the points are scored
individual players.

boardgame.name: Rad Zone Totality
boardgame.description:
The world faces a terrible apocalypse. Without warning the sun’s radiation spiked to alarming levels and under this relentless and deadly barrage humanity succumbed. People fell ill, millions died, populations moved underground into fortified Rad Bunkers, all the time the sun pushing people deeper into the darkness. Many plants and animals perished, and society collapsed. Food and clean water were rationed until people began to starve, and martial law was replaced by irradiated outlaws and bandits roaming the surface in their pain induced craze.

It is down to you to guide a group of survivors as they scavenge for resources on the harsh eradiated surface so they may return and survive in their underground bunker. Can you avoid the radiation hot spots and find the right supplies? Can you escape a terrible fate at the hands of the crazed Rad Heads…can you survive the Rad Zone?

Rad Zone Totality is the follow up game to Rad Zone and although it incorporates the original rules it includes many new ones and players do not need the original game to play it.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 1888-N
boardgame.description:
1888-N ("N" for "north") is an 18xx game set in China in the Beijing area. It features no special rules apart from the various private companies (which depict Chinese landmarks) and is a branch of the 1830-style games. The maps are double-sided, one side with the classic 18xx layout and the other featuring a more fancy artwork.

Two to six players represent investors in railroad companies, spending their initial capital to buy wholly owned private companies and shares in public companies. The public companies are each controlled by the largest shareholder (its president). Public companies build track and run trains in order to earn revenues. These revenues can be paid out as dividends to shareholders or retained to fund further track and rolling stock.

1888-N is the first part in a Chinese trilogy (1888-E and 1888-S are the other two) can be combined with one or both other games for a larger map and more companies.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Zenda: le maitre du stress
boardgame.description:
Objective: Understand and manage stress

Answer questions and complete "Zen challenges" to advance Zenda to the temple. But be careful, you have to get to the end of the course before the ninja, who represents the stress!

Zenda: The Stress Master is designed to help children aged 7 to 14 develop their understanding of stress and their ability to manage it in different everyday situations. The game also leads them to realize that stress is a healthy and useful reaction that is different for each person.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Objectif : Comprendre et gérer le stress

Réponds aux questions et réalise des « défis zen » pour faire avancer Zenda jusqu’au temple. Mais attention, tu dois arriver au bout du parcours avant le ninja, qui représente le stress!

Zenda : le maitre du stress est conçu pour aider les enfants de 7 à 14 ans à développer leur compréhension du stress et leur habileté à le gérer dans différentes situations du quotidien. Le jeu les amène aussi à prendre conscience que le stress est une réaction saine et utile qui est différente pour chaque personne.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Air Mail
boardgame.description:
1925, the US Congress passes the new "Air Mail Act" also known as the "Kelly Act. The Postmaster General will now contract commercial airline companies to carry mail.

Step into the shoes of an aviation tycoon and manage one of these companies competing for the contracts to establish and operate the first airmail service.

Grab the incentives offered by the government by plotting the most efficient routes and developing the technology that will allow you to build the most autonomous and reliable models.

Whoever can make the most profit for their company will win.

Get ready for Airmail to take off!

The aim of Airmail is to make the most profit for your company. There are three main ways to earn revenue:

Transporting packages between the different divisions of the country. The maximum distance you can send a delivery is determined by your level of technology, which you can improve during the game. Obviously, the greater the distance between the package’s origin and its destination, the greater the profit.

Comply with the decrees of the Postal Service. Throughout the game they will be activated as common objectives for all players.

Express Deliveries. At the end of the game, you will gain the benefits of the express deliveries that you have and successfully carry out.
To achieve all of the above, you will have to plot and extend your own routes by connecting the different divisions, playing concession cards and asking for government subsidies.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

boardgame.name: Death Note: Le Jeu d'Enquête
boardgame.description:
Death Note is a hidden identity game in the anime universe, each character having their own objectives to achieve.

At the beginning of the game, the only role revealed, having the role of GM will be L. His mission will be to lead the investigation, distributing suspicions during the 5 rounds of the game with the ultimate goal of discovering who plays the role of Light.

The other players have all their own goals, could help L or not... On each round, they have as main action to look at the active hidden investigation and decide to keep it active or not. If yes, he can add an action card to his hand. These actions cards could be played at different moment during the game, regarding what is indicated on the card.
When each layer around L have looked at the investigation card, L reveals the active one, apply the effect and give the suspicions indicated. At 6 suspicions, a role is revealed.

After 5 rounds, if L is not revealed, he lose the game.
The other player reveal their role, winning some victory points regarding their achieved goals.

The game can be ended earlier if Light is revealed or if 3 role are revealed and killed.

boardgame.name: 寿しロワイヤル (Sushi Royale)
boardgame.description:
寿しロワイヤル (Sushi Royale) is an action and bluffing game from Japan. Players are serving sushi, and trying to grab tea to win.

Welcome to our sushi restaurant! Make and serve popular sushi to your customers! Predict the popular sushi from remaining ingredients and make it!

In the case of a tie in the order, serve tea at once!

In this action game incorporating deduction elements, compete to be the best sushi chef!

Players each guess the sushi to be served by others and holds one of four types of sushi miniatures concealed in their hand. Then, at a shout, everyone reveals the miniatures. Your revealed sushi is served if it forms the (popular) majority. The served Sushi is placed on the plate. You get a cup of tea for every 2 sushi. The first player to get 2 cups of tea wins the game.

The tea is in the center of the play area. In the case of a tie in popularity of the sushi, players race to grab the tea at the shout of "Agari Icchou! (Here's your tea!)" Switch between different actions and move quickly!

へいらっしゃい！人気の寿司を握って、お客様に食べてもらおう！
残りのネタから人気の寿司を予想して、寿司を握れ！
注文が割れたなら、素早くお茶を出すのだ！
推理が絡んだ､アクションゲーム！君も寿司職人一番星を目指せ！
プレイヤーは他の人が出す寿司を推理して、4種の寿しのフィギュアから1つを選び
手に隠して出します。掛け声を合わせて全員で同時に公開します。多数派(人気)なら
1個上がりです。上がった寿司は盛り板の上に乗せます。2個上がったら
お茶を手に入れます。お茶を2個手に入れたら勝ちです。
お茶は場の中央に置かれています。もし寿司の人気が拮抗したなら「アガリ一丁！」の
掛け声とともに、お茶を奪い取ります。早い者勝ちです。切り替えて素早く動こう！

boardgame.name: Pirates Tales
boardgame.description:
In Pirates Tales you take on the role of a pirate captain. You plan adventures in the seven seas and try to pass them with the luck of your dice. Upgrade your ship and improve your dice hand to scam as many doubloons and diamonds as possible. Play cards to get useful additional actions or the protection of the sea, so that you can return home safely.

But beware of the Kraken and all the other dangers on the high seas. If it is a fellow player's turn, make yourself comfortable in the tavern and bid with the other captains on the success or failure of the active player. Will you emerge from the game as the most glorious and richest captain, or will the Kraken be pleased?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Zwergendorf
boardgame.description: In Zwergendorf, the dwarf draft and draw game by Rita Modl, you create your own little dwarf village. To do this, you draw cards with resources and draw them into your plan. You have to be careful not to miscalculate because the dwarves cleverly build all kinds of useful things for their village from each resource during the production phases. For every gold coin a new dwarf comes to the village, for every stone a wall is built, for every combination of wood, stone and beer a tavern is built, and so on. Since the forest clearing available to you as a building site is not the largest, you must plan well in advance so that there is enough room for everything in your dwarf village. Of course, the wishes of the inhabitants must also be taken into account, so there is a lot to plan for your own dwarf village.

boardgame.name: Emerald City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE SHADOW CAPITAL

Join spies, smugglers, liars, cheats, killers, thieves, rebels, anarchists, gangers, thugs, hoods, outlaws, low-lifes, hackers, con artists, hustlers, and more as they gather and try to climb to the summit of the shadowrunning world. In Seattle, the gold glitters brighter and the dungeons are darker, meaning the shadows in between are the widest and most intense in the world.

As a newly free city, Seattle hovers lightly over a pit of ravening wolves, saved only by the fact that as much as one wolf would love to devour the sprawl whole, they equally don’t want any of their competitors to get it. Maintaining that balance is the core desire of city leaders; undoing it has become the obsession of the city’s enemies. Whether shadowrunners decide to pick a side or just play all sides against each other, there is plenty of work to be done and danger to avoid, all while showing they can run the shadows with the best of them.

boardgame.name: The Muerte Files
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They tried to poison him and dumped him in the ocean in his melted armor. They stole his technology, his wealth and bombed his island fortress until barely an island remained. The world thought him dead, and they were right Professor Muerte is indeed dead.

From the ashes, a phoenix will arise the legend says. He is back now and ready to have his vengeance on the traitors and all who have wronged him. Terror Inc. is now reformed stronger and more powerful than ever. Now it is time to extract his pound of flesh. Professor Muerte is dead, now there is only Muerte. The day of reckoning is here;

There shall be blood!

Here you will find all known information about Muerte & Terror Inc. The compilation includes all titles by Tiger Paw Press in one organized volume. All characters, vehicles, allies are included as are several adventure ideas.

boardgame.name: Grýla & The Yule Lads
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mid-Level Holiday Adventure for Player Levels 6 to 8
Intended for Use with Most Fantasy Roleplaying Games

Mǫrkthwait was a small alpine village in the “no man’s land” between warring nations.
When a peace came between these two factions, the villagers reaped the rewards.
However, good fortune can breed resentment, and now there is trouble in the village.
A series of bizarre pranks and robberies are vexing folks, and ruining their Yule spirit.
Can your players solve this intriguing Yuletide mystery in time to save the holidays?

For the uninitiated, Grýla, is one of the ancient evils of the world. She preys on children, like the demonic beast Krampus. No one is sure where she came from or when she was born, or if she was in fact born and not created by the Chaotic powers of the realms. What is known is that she has been around for time immemorial, troubling the folk of the world by preying on them every Yuletide, snatching up their young ones who she deems to be naughty, and devouring them! She is joined in this sinister mission by her vile brood, including Leppalúði, the half-ogre and half-giant third husband of the witch Grýla and father to the 13 Yule Lads; Jólakötturinn (aka the Yule Cat) a supernatural creature that takes the form of a giant, black domesticated cat, who delights in abducting children on Yule who did not receive any new clothes; and The Yule Lads, a group of thirteen mischievous and meddlesome pranksters who like to steal from, vex, and annoy the inhabitants of one unlucky village each winter. One Lad strikes each night for the 13 days leading up to Yule. Together this murderous family delights in causing mischief and mayhem during Yuletide each year, and this year they are coming to your town courtesy of Starry Knight Press!

Adventure Synopsis: Your players will be taking a break in a warm, cozy inn in the village of Mǫrkthwait, having chosen to celebrate the Yule holiday there while waiting out a winter storm. Their hopes of relaxing will be dashed when the village’s Jarl comes to them seeking their help in investigating a series of strange and unsettling occurrences in the village, which have continued for nearly a fortnight. While no serious crimes have occurred, it has vexed the populace and it is dampening their Yuletide spirit.

While investigating your players will discover a dark secret about a newcomer to the village, the beautiful young woman Álffallegur and her thirteen small children, who were abandoned in the village by her seemingly churlish and dishonourable husband just a fortnight ago...just about the time when all the strange pranks and thefts began.

The players' hunches will prove correct! The “beautiful woman” and her children are none other than Grýla and the Yule Lads, polymorphed into human form by her magic, just as Leppalúði was posing as a human male when he dropped them off at the village. Unfortunately the truth is leaned too late, and early on Yule morning Grýla and her brood strike, stealing away with 44 of Mǫrkthwait's innocent children; dragging them back to the lair they have made in an abandoned dwarven fastness, high up in the mountains!

The deceived villagers are angry and scared! They turn to your heroes for aid, offering vast sums in reward for recovering their kinder.
Can you players pull off a Yuletide miracle and save the children of Mǫrkthwait?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Trouble Over Terrans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A High-Level Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 8 to 10
Intended for Use with Most Fantasy Roleplaying Games

After discovering a wondrous vessel capable of flying among the heavens, you managed to somehow activate the vessel. Flying under unknown power and seeming of its own accord, the mysterious ship has now transported you high above the clouds, soaring into the æther over the planet you call home. Now the ship has lost power, your air is dwindling and you find yourself in deep trouble over Terrans.

I am very happy to release the thirteenth adventure in my Old School Series, TROUBLE OVER TERRANS. This short scenario may be used to bring your formerly terrestrial bound players into a wider world of travel among the stars! It is intended for 4 to 6 veteran player characters of levels 8 to 10. In this adventure the players found themselves adrift in the space above the planet Terrans, stranded aboard the inter-spherical ship Marigold, with limited power and a dwindling oxygen supply. The Marigold was featured in our prior adventure SOS11 Ren’s Final Flight, and a map of the ship is included scenario as well.

Synopsis: The adventure begins with players aboard a vessel in low orbit. The ship is on emergency power, having used its reserves to attain orbit. The players have but 15 minutes of oxygen and no motive power. Given this predicament, the ship begins broadcasting a distress signal in Galactic Common on all wavelengths. Shortly thereafter, a response is heard coming over the ship’s internal speakers. They hear the following: “Ahoy distressed vessel, we are coming alongside. By the Spacefarer’s Code, we claim this vessel and all its contents as salvage. Prepare to be boarded”.

Unfortunately for the players, their “rescuers” are a band of piratical marauders who will deem the “contents” of the vessel to include them as well, and they want in to claim their bounty!

Will you players defeat these space pirates and find their way back to terra firm or will they choose to ply the stars?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Pendulum Fighters
boardgame.description:
This a TCG to takes a twist on the usual TCG formula and brings something new to the table and hopefully TCG enthusiast will enjoy. Pendulum Fighters is a dice rolling anime TCG where the goal is to get your opponent's character cards health down to 0,

this can be done by normal battling, or turn up the heat with amplifier cards to assist you in battle and help you catch your opponent off guard or if you are in a pinch, use finisher to jump right back into the game. Just note that using these cards may have a drawback when used that can affect you.

The goal of Pendulum Fighters is to give you the feeling of a heated battle of who is really stronger...As well as some lore into the world and a full story told within the cards themselves.

If you feel that this game has peaked your interest then check down in the "Links" to find out how you can get your hands on this game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Eispicker
boardgame.description:
This fun game of skill can be played in two different versions with 2-4 players. Carefully remove the ice blocks from the ice wall with the ice pick or show off your skills on the ice tower. Your skill is tested in both of these exciting versions, because if the penguin falls, the game is over!

1.Version: Ice wall The game starts when the ice wall is set up and the penguin is in position. You can play this game with 2-4 people. The players take turns to carefully pick an ice block out of the wall with the small hammer (ice pick). Players always have to keep an eye on the little penguin, because if it falls off the wall, the game is over! The player who makes the penguin fall off loses the game.

2.Version: Ice tower Players now take turns to pull out a block of ice from the tower with their hands. The same applies here: If the penguin falls, the game is over and the player who caused it loses the game!

boardgame.name: Trials of Battle
boardgame.description:
You may never have believed in alien abductions before but Trials of Battle will make you a believer. Taken to a distant world, you must compete in the ultimate arena of competition in your heavily armored hover tanks. Equipped with weapons that are far beyond what is available on Earth and with deadly extras to add a little surprise to your enemy's day, you are ready to face the best of the best from all across the galaxy. You may be good but remember, no human has ever made the rank of Battle Master!

Fast Action Battles in the arena!

Trials of Battle puts you in the cockpit of a hovertank. Before each battle, you must buy equipment to add to your hovertank's weaponry, defenses, or special abilities. During battle, you will compete against deadlier and deadlier opponents. These opponents, either controlled by the computer or by people on the network, on a modem, or via the Internet, will have the same goal as you each round. After the battle, you can use your points to upgrade your hover craft. Add plasma weapons or better armor or equip it with jump jets or better sensors or tracking systems. You have the ability to modify your hover craft to fit your playing style!

Play against the computer or against people via modem, LAN, or Internet!

While Trials of Battle's single player play is exceptional due to its native OS/2 AI (artificial intelligence) engine, Trials of Battle really shines in multiplayer play. If you have a modem, are on a network, or are on the internet, you can play your friends (or strangers) in the arena. Unlike most games (including Quake), Trials of Battle can combine the multiplayer options. This means that if you are on a LAN but a friend of yours isn't, your friend can call in and join the game with you and your friends on your LAN. Few games can compete with Trials of Battle when it comes to multiplayer play.

Designed from the ground up for 32bit multitasking operating systems!

The gameplay of Trials of Battle could be described as a combination of Quake (fast paced, true 3D texturing) and Mech Warrior (preparing your armored vehicle, locking weapons, and hostile landscapes). This makes for very potent play.

Trials of Battle is the action game OS/2 users have been waiting for!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Avarice: The Final Saga
boardgame.description:
You weren't even aware that the mysterious and famous billionare Mr. O'Hara was your uncle until you received a surprise letter from him inviting you to his island retreat.

When you arrive, you are not alone, you and a number of other guests who are referred to as "contestants" soon discover that your uncle is missing. Rumors abound that your uncle has hidden millions of dollars in rare jewels somewhere in his vast mansion. But a deeper mystery surrounds his disappearance and his house seems to be hiding a much more sinister secret.

Now you must discover what happened to your uncle and what his plans were. The fate of the entire world may hang in the balance.

Avarice is arguably the most advanced adventure game ever developed for the PC on any platform. While similar to Myst and Riven in basic user interface, Avarice uses the built in power of OS/2 to create a truly dynamic world. Everything in the Avarice world can be touched and manipulated. More than just an adventure/mystery game, Avarice's goal is to make the player feel immersed in its game world. The library is a real library with real books that can be read from cover to cover. Food can be picked up, broken apart, burned, cooked, eaten, etc. The only limit in Avarice is your imagination!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Pensum
boardgame.description:
A trivia game where all players are asked questions from a card, one question (A-E) at a time.
If at any time a player chooses not to answer, or answers wrongly, they do not get to answer the rest of the questions. When all questions have been asked, or when all players are out, players move on the board depending on how many correct answers they have.
At certain points on the track, the players need at least a certain number of correct answers, thereby giving the other players a chance to catch up.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dare or Dare
boardgame.description:
The fast paced, dare based adult party game. See how far you’re willing to go to come out on top. You will be embarrassed, laughing at others, and if all goes right (or wrong), feeling very good.

Roll the tri die, and draw a card from the deck with the corresponding color. The choice is now yours: either perform the dare on the top half of the card, complete it, and collect the points; or decline, lose a life, and put the card face down.

Keep the contents of the bottom half to yourself, because any other player may pick it up and attempt it. Provided they succeed where you failed, they get to collect the points.

Ultimately collect twelve points and crown yourself as the dare champion!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Class Folio: The Warlock
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a Warlock, a binder and filcher of all types of magics and monstrous power. No knowledge is outside of your grasp; when you see potential, you take it without question. You might be a renegade magic user exiled from the scholars who once taught you, one who seeks more than treasure and riches, or an occultist who disregards the standard norms of magic use.

This folio brings a new style of spell caster to Low Fantasy Gaming!! Not bound by the norms of arcana the Warlock heralds spell thievery themes to the game, however things don't stop there! Seizing magical abilities are also within the their reach, using tricks and mimicry to emulate more monstrous power.

boardgame.name: Deck EXPRESS
boardgame.description:
The majestic steam engine waits in the yard. As train moguls, you will invest in emerging railroad companies, build track, and collect rewards from the bank. The game moves as fast as a train on new tracks. Only the wealthiest investor will end victorious.

—description from the rulebook

Deck Express is a railroad investment game. Players take one of four possible actions on their turn including buying shares, building track, paying dividends, and taking a loan. Investments in wealthy companies with locomotives will earn more. To win, have as much money as possible before the bank runs out.

All you need is a deck of cards.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 04
boardgame.description:
BLASTER: Vol. 4 includes two exclusive standalone games, and three expansions.

Last Days: Legends
Official Expansion for Last Days
Rules for including The Luchador, The Mechanic, and the Waitress in your games of Last Days. These rules are compatible with the modern game setting and both the core Rulebook and Seasons Supplements. Keep an eye out for new miniatures available via Temple of the West.

BRUTL! Tank Arena
Standalone Game
BRUTL! Tank Arena is a beer and pretzels style game of insanely fun tank battles. Your humble author wanted a ruleset to use all those cool tanks he had lying around, but something simple and required minimal effort. With only a bit of terrain and a single tank per player, BRUTL! Is both easy to start and plays quick, getting to the best parts of miniature wargaming, blowing up your opponent.

Sludge Nations
Expansion for Sludge War, core rules available in BLASTER: Games Anthology 03.
The world of sludge is vast and each player’s interpretation of the setting is a valid iteration in the decaying multiverse. The Nation Factions described here will represent both existing nations and archetypes found across the dying world. For what it’s worth, these factions are primarily focused on the western branchways inhabited by mankind and don’t represent the full breadth of the sludge world.

Gaslands: Legacy (Part II)
Official Campaign Expansion for Gaslands: Refuelled, part I available in BLASTER: Games Anthology 03.
Earth gets an eviction notice from Mars, and becomes dismantled and reassembled into a progressively more chaotic post-post-apocalyptic world. Randomly generate an illegal build and get out of the factory fast before you become dismantled yourself. Unique LEGACY Gaslands rules, and the remaining narrative scenarios. (The first five scenarios in the story are b in Vol. 3, but you don't need them to play these four, as the Legacy Rules are recapped in Vol.4.)

Deathship One
Solo/Co-op Standalone Game
Deathship One is a solo or co-operative miniatures game in which the player controls a small squad of warriors attempting to fight their way through an alien death trap. It’s designed to be fast and fun and to use a minimum of miniatures and terrain. It’s also designed to be limited. The whole game consists of 5 scenarios or ‘rooms’. The order of those rooms can change from game-to-game, but you always play all five, assuming you live that long

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tenchi Muyo! War on Geminar
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Tenchi Muyo series is huge, and the canonicity may not be particularly clear to the uninitiated. This part of the series and Jump take place after the start of the main timeline and GXP. The story takes place in the world of Germinar, and you no longer need to worry about multiversal goddesses, planet-busting trees, and other such things for your stay.

boardgame.name: Poison
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Jungles, Sewers, Swamps, and Poison Monster Lairs in Minutes!

Quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with green dragons, hags, plant creatures, venomous creatures, vermin, or staging battles or travel in jungles, sewers, or swamps.

In this Poison template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Infestation (magical terrain)
Jungle (nonmagical terrain)
Poison Rain (nonmagical weather)
Poison Vapors (nonmagical weather)
Rotting Monster Carcass (nonmagical terrain)
Sewer (nonmagical terrain)
Swamp (nonmagical terrain)

boardgame.name: Necrotic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Blighted, Cursed, and Unholy Lairs in Minutes!

Quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with demons, devils, druids, necromancers, undead, and warlocks, or staging battles in the lower planes.

In this extreme template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Blighted Wilderness (magical terrain)
Cursed Ground (magical terrain)
Unholy Ground (magical terrain)
Broken Bones (necrotic contamination, curse)
Gushing Gore (necrotic contamination, curse)
Living Death (necrotic contamination, disease)
Soul Rot (necrotic contamination, disease)
Zombie Virus (necrotic contamination, disease)

boardgame.name: Radiant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Holy, Lunar, and Solar Monster Lairs in Minutes!

Enjoy quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with any GM running encounters using celestials, desert creatures, lycanthropes, moon or sun worshipper cults, moonlit aberrations from beyond the stars, and for staging battles in sun-baked badlands, deserts, or in blistering summer heat.

In this Radiant template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and magic items for:

Holy Ground (magical terrain)
Moonlit Ground (magical terrain)
Solar Ground (magical terrain)
Desert or Badlands (nonmagical terrain)
Heatwave (nonmagical weather)
Sand Dunes (Desert) (nonmagical terrain)
Sandstorm (Dust Storm) (nonmagical weather)

boardgame.name: Air
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Raging Storms and Flying Monster Lairs in Minutes!

Enjoy quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with flying or storm-based monsters. 5th Edition (5e) Game Masters can use them to run intense, cinematic encounters using air elementals, blue or bronze dragons, cloud or storm giants, as well as campaigns featuring flying creatures or monsters that live high up in hills, mountains, or in the clouds themselves.

In this extreme template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Cloud Castle (magical terrain)
High Elevation (nonmagical terrain)
Lightning Storm (nonmagical terrain)
Thunderstorm (nonmagical terrain)
Tornado (nonmagical terrain)
Windstorm (nonmagical terrain)

boardgame.name: Acid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Acid and Slime Monster Lairs in Minutes!

Enjoy quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with acid and slime monsters. 5th Edition (5e) Game Masters can use them to run intense, cinematic encounters using aberrations, black dragons, or oozes, as well as any campaign featuring Cthulhu cosmic horror or body horror themes, or adventure plots that riff off classic sci-fi/horror movies like Aliens or The Thing.

In this extreme template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Acidic Slime (magical terrain)
Slippery Slime (magical terrain)
Acid Rain (nonmagical terrain)
Acidic Vapors (nonmagical terrain)
Quickslime (nonmagical terrain, trap)
Quickslime Geyser (nonmagical terrain, trap)

boardgame.name: Unknown Armies PDF Reference Tools
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Unknown Armies is a game spread out across five books. In order to help you find the information you need about adepts, avatars, unnatural entities, and unexplained phenomena, we’ve gathered together a master index with some secondary indices. Each index is color coded and may be printed out or used right from your screen.

In addition to the index, we’ve recreated the charts and tables from the GM screen that came with the Deluxe Set, updated some of the information, and bundled them in with character sheets and a quick reference sheet.

boardgame.name: Earth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Earthquakes and Forest, Mountain, and Underground Monster Lairs in Minutes!

Enjoy quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with earth elementals, dragons, hags, hill or stone giants, as well as campaigns featuring forest creatures or monsters that live in hills or mountains, or deep underground.

In this extreme template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Chaos of Creation (magical terrain)
Cave Complex (nonmagical terrain)
Chasm or Cliff (nonmagical terrain)
Earthquake (nonmagical terrain)
Forest (nonmagical terrain)
Hills or Mountains (nonmagical terrain)
Mine Shaft (nonmagical terrain)
Mud or Clay (nonmagical terrain)
Quarry (nonmagical terrain)

boardgame.name: Cold
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Winter Storms and Cold Monster Lairs in Minutes!

Enjoy quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with frost giants, water elementals, silver or white dragons, as well as campaigns featuring cold creatures or undead that live in cold climates or emerge in winter.

In this extreme template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Cold As Ice (magical terrain for cold creatures and/or undead)
Blizzard (nonmagical terrain)
Frozen Lake or River (nonmagical terrain)
Hailstorm (nonmagical terrain)
Snowstorm (nonmagical terrain)
Thunder Snow/Sleet (nonmagical terrain)
Winter Storm (nonmagical terrain)

boardgame.name: Fire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Raging Infernos and Fire Monster Lairs in Minutes!

Quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with devils, fire elementals, fire giants, gold or red dragons, or staging battles in burning buildings, forest fires, volcanos, the Hells, or the Elemental Plane of Fire.

In this extreme template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Hot As Hell (magical terrain)
Burning Building (nonmagical terrain)
Fire Devil (nonmagical terrain)
Firestorm (nonmagical terrain)
Lave Flow (Active) (nonmagical terrain)
Lava Tubes (nonmagical terrain)
Volcanic Eruption (nonmagical terrain)
Wildfire (nonmagical terrain)

boardgame.name: Fighters and Rogues
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover 250 magic items for 5th Edition (5e) fighters and rogues!
Items that scale with your proficiency bonus
Items that grant class abilities or racial traits
Items that grant monster traits
Items that unlock bonus powers based on class
Magical tattoos
New and revised weapon rules

This 5th Edition handbook is perfect for players and game masters (GMs) who want to add epic fun and variety to your Fifth Edition game with hundreds of martial and rogue-based magic items.

boardgame.name: Barbarians, Druids, and Rangers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover 250 exclusive 5e magic items for barbarians, druids, and rangers!
Items that scale with your proficiency bonus
Items that scale with your rage damage bonus
Items that grant beast traits
Items that grant class abilities or racial traits
Magical tattoos and shrunken heads
New and revised weapons including bolas, spiked gauntlets, and war picks

This 5th Edition handbook is perfect for players and game masters (GMs) who want to add epic fun and variety to your Fifth Edition game with hundreds of wilderness-based magic items.

boardgame.name: Clerics, Monks, and Paladins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover 250 magic items for 5th Edition (5e) clerics, monks, and paladins!
Items that scale with your proficiency bonus
Items that grant class abilities or racial traits
Items that unlock bonus powers based on class
Items that create consecrated and desecrated ground
Magical tattoos, divine incense, and holy symbols of protection
New and revised weapons for all three character classes (especially monks)

This 5th Edition handbook is perfect for players and game masters (GMs) who want to add epic fun and variety to your Fifth Edition game with hundreds of divine-based magic items.

boardgame.name: Bards, Sorcerers, Warlocks and Wizards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover 250 magic items for 5th Edition (5e) bards, sorcerers, warlocks, and wizards!
Items that scale with your proficiency bonus
Items that grant class abilities or racial traits
Items that unlock bonus powers based on class
Magical tattoos and necromancer skinned gloves
New alchemy, constructs, undead, and weapons

This 5th Edition handbook is perfect for players and game masters (GMs) who want to add epic fun and variety to your Fifth Edition game with hundreds of arcane-based magic items.

boardgame.name: Curios, Oddities, and Trinkets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover 250 magic items for all 5th Edition (5e) character classes!
Items that add spice to low and mid-level play
Items that let you change spell damage type
Items that unlock bonus powers based on class
Dozens of magical books to stock your shelves
An easy inventory for magic shops, guilds, etc.

This 5th Edition handbook is perfect for players and game masters (GMs) who want to add epic fun and variety to your Fifth Edition game with hundreds of low- to medium-power magic items.

boardgame.name: Cryptych (Vol 1, Issue 4)
boardgame.description:
FROM THE EXPERTS: Features & Columns

- Things That Go Bump In My Head - Dinosaur characters and Shades of Love scenarios kernel
- Cryptology - AK! From acid to ague)
- World Building 101 - Civilization
- The Art of the Gamemaster - Government and your game
- The Sorcerer’s Apprentice - New cards ideas and deckbuilding for Magic: The GatheringTM
- The Stacked Deck - Puzzles and a Contest!

- Ed Greenwood - Forgotten Realms® designer
- The Storyteller - Director John Carpenter
- Dinosaur Wizard - Jurassic Park® animator Dennis Muren
- A Man of this Word - Author Dave Duncan

GAME MASTER INVENTIONS: Game Scenarios

- Through the Eye of a Needle - Designed for use with TalislantaTM

OPENING DOORS: Alternate Views

- Comic Culture - Money For Nothing? & Enter Sandman
- Demonna’s Movie Views - Demolition Man

NOTES FROM THE SOURCE: Newsletters

- The Mayfair Games Train Newsletter - Poster Giveaway!

- West End Games News - Contest! Design a creature & get published
- Multiversal Enquirer #1 - Grimoire Games’ Arduin updates & a call for software testers

- The Rag and Bone Place - Studio X profiles Craig Hamilton
- Treasures from the Magic Pool - Faysylwood Press updates

DEPARTMENTS

- Parturition – Contest winners announced!

- Random Encounters (Convention calendar)
- The Marketplace (Classified Ads)
- A Hero Named Harold
- The Herald (New Releases)
- Index to Advertisers

boardgame.name: Cryptych (Vol 1, Issue 5)
boardgame.description:
EXPLORATIONS: Features

- A Recipe For Live Roleplaying - Create your own LARP game
- Live Action Roleplay – Nero Style - A Dark Introduction to the NERO LARP system
- A Dark Reflection - A Story of Magic and Artifacts PLUS Artifact Cut-outs!
- City Of the World, Hall Of The Muses - The story of Alexandria and its Library

A PLACE OF OUR OWN: Columns

- Things That Go Bump In My Head - Magical Mysteries: Scenario Seeds & Magic Items.
- Cryptology - Behind the Philosopher’s Stone
- The Stacked Deck - Great Dalmuti
- The Sorcerer’s Apprentice - Transformations: Variant Game Idea, FAQ for Arabian Nights, Official Card Codes for Arabian Night, and a Craft Idea

PEOPLE TALK: Interviews

- Untangling Terry - Terry Brooks, author of Magic Kingdom & Shannara series
- A Conversation with Richard - Game Designer, Richard Garfield creator of Magic: The Gathering

OPENING DOORS: Alternate Views

- Dr. Tomorrow’s Lessons from the Future - Modern Magic
- Comic Culture - Fish Nor Fowl
- Demonna’s Movie Views - Pod People

NOTES FROM THE SOURCE: Newsletters

- The Mayfair Train Games Newsletter - Updates & DC Heroes announcement
- Digital Alchemist - An Introduction to Digital Alchemy
- West End Games News - Secrets are told . . .
- NBOS Software Update - PC-GP 2.2 Just Released !
- Multiversal Enquirer #2 - Grimoire Games’ Arduin updates & a call for software testers
- Heartbeat Number 5 - Heartbreaker profiles Kev Adams & makes an announcement!
- The Rag and Bone Place - Studio X profiles Jeff Laubenstein
- Words on the Wind - The Howling Falcon release King of the Sandbox variants . . . !
- Reaper’s Digest - Reaper Miniatures : The Reaper Story & A Profile of Chris Paine
- The Apothecary - Wizards of the Coast development notes for Lyceum Arcanum
- Aerie - The Peregrine introduces Murphy’s World
- Nasteez Newz - Grim Reaper Casting lets out the nasteez newz
- The Global Warming - Global Games’ announcements
- Treasures from the Magic Pool - Faysylwood Press FAQ for Quest for the Faysylwood

FAMILIAR PLACES: Departments

- Parturition – Screams from the natives . . .
- Letters to the Editor
- Tabletop Revue (Review of Legions of Steel)
- From the Gaming Tables(Reviews of Arduin, British Rails, DC Heroes 3rd Ed., Lost Souls, Nights’ End, Survival Margin, Traveller-TNE)
- The Open Book (Book Reviews of The Shining Ones, The Unspeakable Oath)
- World Beat (International Updates)
- Random Encounters (Convention Calendar)
- The Marketplace (Classified Ads)
- A Hero Named Harold
- The Herald (New Releases)
- The Last Word (Index to Advertisers)

boardgame.name: Token Economy
boardgame.description:
Token Economy is set in the world of modern finance, where you can buy tokens as a share of an object, which can or cannot be divided in real (soccer stadiums, clubs, oldtimers...). The currency you pay with and you can bet on, are crypto currencies, like the well known BitCoin.

Players move around the track in a Monopoly-style, having junctions in some places. The space where you move to, determines which share you may buy, or how much rent you have to pay. Some spaces cause events, or changes in stock prices. At the end, the player with the most valuable assets is the winner.

boardgame.name: Smash Up: Deepreef Crag Promo Card
boardgame.description:
To promote their Kickstarter campaign for Dead Reckoning, AEG released free print-and-play promotional cards for several of their games, such as Tiny Towns, Santa Monica, Space Base, Cat Lady, and of course Smash Up. Physical copies of the promos are available to those who pledged it.

Deepreef Crag is the promo card for Smash Up. It is a base that reads: When this base scores, it the total power equals the breakpoint, the winner gains 1 additional VP.

boardgame.name: There's a Song for That
boardgame.description:
There’s A Song For That is an adult party game inspired by Cards Against Humanity and What Do You Meme. Music fans will love this game. There’s A Song For That is for 3 or more players and is intended for adults. Gameplay lasts between 30-90 minutes. There are over 200 cards in a deck.

How To Play

Each player picks six random song title cards.
Players take turns picking a situation card.
Each of the remaining players play a song title card that they think best goes with the situation card.
The player who played the situation card picks the song title card they think goes best. that player gets a point.
The Player at the end of the game with the most points wins.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hostile Environment: Special Forces
boardgame.description:
Hostile Environment: Special Forces is a fast-paced tactical 28mm miniatures game that is designed to be played on a battle mat with a 1” grid. The game is based on the Hostile Environment world, but players may use whatever modern or futuristic miniatures they have from Vietnam, Cold War or Science Fiction eras.

Hostile Environment uses a die-pull initiative system to keep players on their toes. Better soldiers get greater odds of more activations, but lesser soldiers are allowed more numbers to keep fights balanced.

Each miniature represents a single unit ranging in skill from green to elite. There are over 15 different weapon types and 6+ armor types from modern weapons and armor to alt-future tech.

Most matches take about 90 minutes using at most two dozen miniatures.

H.E.: Special Forces can be played solo, using the Hostile Tactical AI card deck (sold separately).

2050, the world has entered total chaos. P68P, a poisonous pollen has killed over a billion people, while the toxic gnidia plant, once bred in labs, continues to spread like wildfire. Governments that once ruled humanity have fallen into darkness.

“The Great Wipe,” a hacker attack by the Red 76’ers in 2038 has virtually erased the internet. Now, only a few left have the knowledge to bring back the sciences that have been forgotten. Only the READ, a source of collective consciousness, allows mankind to share information. But, Paven the creator of “the language of God,” rules from the grave, spreading his mesmerism into weaker minds, leaving the zombies to his controlling thoughts.

Failure of silver, the nano blood that cured cancer and heart disease has left mankind grappling with age old viruses thought to be extinct. Scarmine Lab’s mercenaries formed a special force of Population Insurance Tactics (PIT) to find humans that can still create antibodies that have become dormant in most humans.

All that is left of the world is a Hostile Environment.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Secrets of the Vibrant Isle
boardgame.description:
From Kickstarter:

The Vibrant Isle is a legend, a place of mystery, wonders, and fell secrets. Your character has sought it out and is now shipwrecked on its shore. Will they be allowed to stay on the island?

Secrets of the Vibrant Isle is a solo tabletop roleplaying game where you portray a character shipwrecked on a fantastical island. As you play the game, you'll scavenge the shipwreck, protect your camp, improve yourself, and explore many dozens of the island's beautiful wonders and dark corners.

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 266 - Apr 2022)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 266
April 2022

Reviews: Quests of Yore / Starfinder / Twilight: 2000

boardgame.name: Freed of Feeling
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Two-hour adventure set in Hallowfen, the creator’s Feywild domain, playable by D&D Adventurers League Forgotten Realms characters levels 1-4. Part of the Dungeoncraft program for The Wild Beyond the Witchlight season.

The domain of Hallowfen is a refuge for those seeking to flee the predations of other Archfey. Ruled over by Ob, the Magnanimous, those who come to Hallowfen are allowed to live unburdened by their past crimes, so long as they abide by Ob's rules. A hexblood by the name of Oona Chickenbiter has chosen to creatively interpret these rules, much to the detriment of the other denizens of Hallowfen. Your party, newly stranded in this strange land, are tasked with rescuing a few of her captives.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Included in this Season 11 AL-legal adventure is a full-color PDF.

CONTENT WARNING: Kidnapping, Theft of Emotions, Violence
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Elemental Stances and Intent
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Add strategic depth to your combat and social conflicts with the element system for Katanas and Kimonos.

boardgame.name: Megalith Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 592nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a dirt road flanked by numerous megalithic standing stones.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Boy Problems (3rd Ed.)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It is many years into the future. A wealthy and powerful person [or persons] has claimed a rare and much sought after prize: the "vault" of 200 unreleased [this is real!] songs from renowned Canadian pop artist, Carly Rae Jepsen [CRJ). Hired by an anonymous sponsor, your team of highly trained individuals will raid a well-defended location to retrieve said item.

boardgame.name: Turf War: Unicorn City
boardgame.description: In Turf War: Unicorn City, you role play as the prospective leader of a gang of adorably cute unicorns (if I don't say so myself), must recruit them from the deck into your squad, and then engage in "rumbles" against other players to decide who ultimately wins the turf war.

boardgame.name: Cruis'n Blast
boardgame.description:
Cruis’n Blast, developed by the crack Raw Thrills studio team, takes Cruis’n into the new millennium as players zoom 200 mph through the bustle of London, blast through the exotic wonders of Madagascar, celebrate Carnival in Rio, amaze to the hi tech splendor of Singapore, and drive an earth-shaking thriller through Death Valley.

GAME FEATURES:
– Officially licensed from Nintendo
– Immersive covered cockpit seating
– Massive 42″ HD LCD display
– Family-friendly gameplay
– 5 Exciting Courses
– Over 20 vehicles
– High-reliability Electronics
– Over 1000 Dynamic color-changing LED’s
– Cutting edge graphics and sound

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: TwinStar Valley
boardgame.description:
TwinStar Valley is a fun and accessible competitive game that has you controlling a mining company active in a beautiful secluded valley. You will construct a logistical network to transport valuable resources towards self-build factories.
The goal of the game is to both earn a capital through carefully selling these assets to a fluctuating market and fulfilling contracts that allow you to score Victory points.

The game combines route-building and market manipulation but attempts to present these elements in an easy to grasp system, offering freedom and tough decisions.
Twinstar uses a unique Action selection mechanism and original twists to the genre of logistical games to create a fun, intense and joyful experience that both casual an more experienced gamers can enjoy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: And The Gunslinger Followed
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
And The Gunslinger Followed is a solo TTRPG where you play as a chosen character archetype chasing a villain known as the Cowboy across the desert.

It's plain to see for everyone where my inspirations lie. This particular game is heavily inspired by The Dark Tower series by Stephen King, as well as many western tropes.

As you can probably tell just from the name, this game does draw ideas from the American Wild West era. But just because we draw inspiration from something doesn't mean we approve of it. The Wild West was an era of racism and colonialism for America. Modern media tends to heavily romanticize the era, and that is an issue. It should not be romanticized.

boardgame.name: Midhalla
boardgame.description:
Midhalla is a euro-like cooperative dungeoncrawler with no dice rolling. Besides strategic hero mechanics it features tower defense elements and a character-centered story-driven campaign with campaign unlocks set in a fantasy Viking setting.

As you play the campaign, you follow the story of Harkon on his path from a freshly trained warrior to becoming the legendary hero of Midhalla who faces demonic invaders threatening to destroy the world of the living.

At the heart of Midhalla's gameplay is a strategic hero combat mechanic system, that minimizes luck-based elements and emphasizes open-information. Midhalla also features tower defense (or actually trap defense) elements where players gather and invest resources between combat phases to prepare for incoming waves of enemies. Another core part is the story-based exploration system, which allows players to follow the unfolding tale of the main hero Harkon from his perspective during each scenario.

The campaign mechanic enables players to unlock further elements as they progress, increasing complexity and gameplay options through additional unlocks things such as heroes & classes, items, new campaign monsters but also narrative elements which give more insight into the lore of Midhalla. The campaign and all scenarios within it are fully replayable and the monster spawn mechanism along with the variety of heroes and their unique mechanics will make each replay unique.
