boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #16 - Mar 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magical items like the screecher shield, atlas esoterica, orb of remote casting, and rod of forcefangs!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like ghost wolf, blood to sap, eldritch fever, and repel elementals!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the understalker, oath of discovery, and labyrinth domain!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the heartbreaking erodaemon, the sinister ash hag, and the benevolent moon dog!

boardgame.name: Miguelito's Murder
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This quick scenario is designed to be played over a lunch hour with some coworkers. A serene urban setting gives way to a bloody corpse in the alley. Is your PC ready to put on their detective hat?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for a single, 2nd level adventurer and DM.

boardgame.name: Star Trek Adventures: Discovery Season 1 Player Characters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 22-page PDF contains player character statistics for the crew of the U.S.S. Discovery NCC-1031 as seen in Season 1 of Star Trek: Discovery. The PDF includes Captain Gabriel Lorca, Commander Saru, Lieutenant Paul Stamets, Lieutenant Commander Hugh Culber, Michael Burnham, Lieutenant Ash Tyler, Cadet Sylvia Tilly, Emperor Philippa Georgiou, and L’Rell. It also includes player rules for Kelpiens, statistics for several supporting characters, and game statistics for U.S.S. Discovery NCC-1031.

boardgame.name: El Albañil de Horus
boardgame.description:
Elkin is a stonemason Horus spoke to in a dream giving him the secret to end the tyranny of his oppressors under his people.

The objective of the game is to get 3 magic bricks to line up in order to collapse the pyramid!

In each turn, the player will have to move forward (orthogonally or diagonally) one of their bricks, capture one opponent's brick (jumping above it, taking it to their opponent's first row), jump over one of their own bricks, or make a wall movement (move or jump laterally) on the fifth row. Movements can be combined in one turn with the same brick.

The game ends when a player wins by getting three bricks on the fifth row, or breaking five opponent's bricks (when they reach the sixth row).

—user summary

boardgame.name: Paper Dungeons: Missões Extras
boardgame.description:
Paper Dungeons: Missões Extras is a kit of 4 promotional dungeons that adds to the replayability of the original game and expand the game's narrative.
A mandatory extra for those who want the complete Paper Dungeons experience.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Paper Dungeons: A Dungeon Scrawler Game

boardgame.name: Mord im Villenviertel: Wer tötete Edith Krause?
boardgame.description:
The tranquil little town of Waldstedt am See is in shock. A murder has taken place! While solving the case a family drama unravels that puzzles the investigators. Hence, the public prosecutor decides to hand the case over to you, students of the police academy, to help solve the mysterious murder case. You will have to investigate as a team, examine evidence and analyse interrogations. Who is responsible for the murder? Who is innocent? Find the clues and solve the case!

As a team (or solo if that’s your thing) you will have to investigate all police documents, determine the murder weapon, unseal sealed documents, interrogate persons of interest, corroborate their alibis and find the culprit who killen the old and wealthy leady Mrs. Edith Krause. Your investigations will take place in a multimedia environment - just as real investigative work! You will receive a police file and sealed record as hard copies and will need to use your laptop or mobile phone to log into the digital records of the crime case. Here you will be able to talk to persons of interest, the public prosecutor of Waldstedt am See and answer questions to your ongoing investigation.

The murder mystery investigation will take you approximately 90 to 180 minutes. Due to the sealed document, which you first need to unseal, you can easily split your crime investigation into two evenings and continue the next day - no problem!

The murder mystery case investigation is suitable for children from the age of 12 years and above. We recommend the help of adults and to not leave children to their own devices, they will/might need assistance. The investigation is primarily aimed at adults.


Im beschaulichen Städtchen Waldstedt am See wird es spannend. Ein Mord ist geschehen! Bei der Aufklärung des Falls entspinnt sich ein Familiendrama, welches die Ermittler:innen vor ein Rätsel stellt. Aus diesem Grund beschließt die Staatsanwaltschaft, Euch, die Studierenden der Polizeiakademie, als neue Ermittler zu Rate zu ziehen. Ermittelt gemeinsam, untersucht die Asservate und analysiert die Verhöre. Wer hat den Mord begangen? Und wer ist unschuldig? Findet die Beweise und klärt den Fall!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SinkingStone Keep
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Waveride Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

Fear stalks the swamps! The ruins of SinkingStone Keep has thrown its lizard like shadow over the village of Soggy Bottom. Can you and your fellow adventurers root out this festering evil and destroy it? Beware, many who enter the swamp are never seen or heard from again!

boardgame.name: Ten Plagues
boardgame.description:
Ten Plagues, The Card game is a family game for 2-4 Players based on the story of the Ten Plagues of Egypt.

In this card game players race to collect sets of cards to complete the pyramid goals, but hurry, your objectives may change quickly as the plagues strike. Be the player with the most pyramid points by the end of the game to win.

In the game, players have a hand of ten card depicting the plagues of Egypt as described in the Torah. Each turn they will draw a new card from the deck and discard. They then will have an opportunity to complete a goal displayed within the pyramid. Each time a goal is completed a plague event will be revealed. Each plague event will cause player's hands to be impacted in varies ways. The game will end after the last plague is revealed and the player with most pyramid points will be declared the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Don't Get Got!: Con Edition
boardgame.description:
Extra pack of stand alone challenges given away at various conventions including Airecon 2022.

This game is all about completing secret missions, so when you open the pack, make sure that you read the rules and don't look at all the cards. Otherwise, you won't be able to play - which would be very sad indeed.

boardgame.name: Roll-Z: Coop Mode
boardgame.description:
This is the cooperative mode expansion for Roll-Z and requires the base game to play.

This two-player mode is played pretty much the same way as the base game, but we recommend that you familiarize yourself with the base game before moving on to this mode.

boardgame.name: Up in Arms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Old World is a dangerous place. With the Empire fractured within and threatened by enemies without, it is only wise to learn the skills of a soldier, or to employ those who already have. Some may say that to live by the sword is to die by the sword, and there is truth to this. But in the wilds of the Empire, to refuse to live by the sword is to die by the sword even sooner.

Up in Arms provides options and guidance for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay Characters who follow warrior careers. It focuses on abilities that players and GMs can make use of to add variety and expertise to the fighting folk of the Old World.

This 144 page book contains:

A discussion of the Cult of Myrmidia, giving the most comprehensive guide yet published to the beliefs and practices of those who worship the Goddess of Strategy.
Soldiers of all Stripes, detailing the experience of the rank-and-file members of the Empire’s glorious state troops, and providing new careers such as the handgunner, halberdier, and greatsword.
A history of the role of mercenaries in the wars of the Old World, including background and rules to support playing Tilean Characters and other dogs of war.
A guide to the renowned knightly orders of the Empire, with options for joining secular orders, templar chapters, or going it alone as a freelance knight.
An expanded list of weapons and armour, from basic arms such as swords and axes, to exotic specialised equipment such as weighted nets and pavises.
Rules for taking cover within vehicles and buildings — and counterpart rules for blowing vehicles and buildings up with devastating artillery.
Detail on the employment of hireling NPCs, including a system for generating individual quirks and work ethics.
Optional and additional rules covering new Endeavours, alternative approaches to Critical Injury, mounted combat, uses of Advantage, Pursuits, and Talents.

boardgame.name: Pirate's Cove
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick micro dungeons - Small, quick dungeons for OSR and 5e games.

Intended to be run in one adventuring night, Quick Micro Dungeons are a DM's best friend.

The sixth installment goes nautical as we explore a pirate cove deep in the jungle. Captain Louis has recently stolen a magical artifact by the name of "The Mermaid's Eye".

boardgame.name: Cult of Poseidon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Poseidon, one of the greediest and most dangerous deities in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Poseidon's main temples
Festivals held in Poseidon's honor
The Poseidon Command Warrior Cult
Two New Spells (earthshaker and trident of disaster)
Paladin's Oath of Disaster

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 05
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

The llightweight Grapnel of climbing, giving advantage to anyone who uses it
Wave bangle, allowing wave control and water breathing
Assorted freight of good quality
The Weapon Rack of Preparedness, which repairs & cleans weapons overnight

boardgame.name: Marvel Battleworld: Series 2 Premium Game Pieces Pack – Spider-Island Groot
boardgame.description: Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos! Upgrade your gameplay with premium plastic pieces including a new holo-foil Danger Coin and plastic Danger Tokens!

boardgame.name: Marvel Battleworld: Series 2 Storage Case – Pork Grind
boardgame.description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos!

Store more than 50 Heroes and their Hero Cards! Case securely locks so players can transport their collection to play with friends! Includes exclusive never-before-available Pork Grind Hero and foil Hero Card!

boardgame.name: Football Highlights 2052
boardgame.description: App version of the game Football Highlights 2052.

boardgame.name: Gaia Project
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Gaia Project.

boardgame.name: Cheesy Trials
boardgame.description:
CAN MOUSE-KIND DEMONSTRATE COGNITION?
Control Echo the Mouse with the joystick and learn his abilities as you go. Collect the next piece of Cheese before the time is up. You have infinite clones, but must be successful to finish.

There are 36 rooms to master, over three experiments.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Jagdpanzer (38t) Hertzer Expansion
boardgame.description:
More commonly known as the Hetzer, this pocket sized tank destroyer provides a low cost option for the points conscious commander. If you have points to spare though then there are plenty of options to customise it’s performance on the battlefield.

The Jagdpanzer 38(T) Hetzer is a crowd favourite. It combines a solid set of stats, a deceptively small size and a relatively low cost that makes it an affordable Tank Destroyer for a platoon commander on a budget. Left alone at the back of the battlefield sniping enemies it will quickly earn it’s keep, but with a few small upgrades you can really enhance the ability of the Hetzer to be a threat on the table as well as improving it’s chances of surviving. First up an Improved Rotation Mechanism will give your tank a nice improvement to its initiative, increasing your chances of being in the right place to get your shots off. Adding Wilhelm Lindemann to your crew will also improve your initiative in the movement phase whilst also increasing your chances of avoiding critical hits. Last but not least, a crew member with the Concealment ability will stack with the inherent Tank Destroyer special rule and keep your tank safe whilst in cover.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M24 Chaffee Expansion
boardgame.description:
The M24 Chaffee is a real speedster, combing high initiative and movement to find the perfect spot on the battlefield. Combine this with the new Commanders Vision System and you can aid your allies by stripping away an enemies Cover for the rest of the phase.

The American built M24 Chaffee brings a new Light Tank to the battlefield and unlike the older Valentine this one is fast… we mean really fast! Combining high speed and good initiative with a gun that cannot be easily ignored, it is a threat to every other tank on the battlefield. Befitting it’s role as a spotter, an easy addition is a Commanders Vision System. This allows the Chaffee to strip away enemy tanks cover bonus, making them an easier target for other friendly tanks.

The key there is to make sure you have the highest initiative possible on this tank and if you need a little buff to achieve that, then the 75mm Gun M17 is exactly what you need.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – T-70 Expansion
boardgame.description:
With over 8,000 tanks built during the war, the T-70 was the mainstay of Soviet light tank units. Straight of the box it combines some fairly average stats, but with a little work the T-70 can shine in any situation with specific upgrades available for the gun and engine.

The T-70 adds another Light Tank to the mix. Built in large numbers by the Soviet army it is a blank canvas ready for commanders to tweak to meet their mission needs. It comes with relatively high initiative (for a Soviet vehicle) but this can be improved through use of the M-80 engine which enhances the tanks initiative in the movement phase – it also works on the SU-76 and SU-122A (spoilers!). As a Light Tank the T-70 doesn’t necessarily have the highest number of hit points or defense but a Low Noise System has the potential to give a light tank a nice defensive buff, if the dice are on your side.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Crusader Expansion
boardgame.description:
Widely known for it’s performance in the deserts of North Africa the Crusader is perfect for high speed attack runs on an unsuspecting enemy. Combine its naturally high initiative with Improved Communications to give a boost to the entire platoon.

The Crusader, used by the British in the deserts of North Africa, is another speedster like the American M24 Chaffee. It gains an additional hit point over its American friend, but at the cost of two crew slots and the Arrow Shot special rule (which means it is less likely to cause critical hits). This means that straight of the box it will hang around longer, but possibly at the cost of dealing less damage… but if you are in the fight for one extra round that may be all the time you need to win the game! If you are looking to reduce the cost of your tank you can upgrade the gun to an OQF 3-inch Howitzer MK.I which removes the Arrow Shot rule and gives your tank High Explosive. This is a great option if you are feeling lucky with your dice… well are you?

boardgame.name: Sorcery: Contested Realm
boardgame.description:
Two players take the roles of Avatars, assemble their own decks, and then cast a variety of elemental spells, summon powerful minions, and shape the world around them from their Atlas to increase their dominance and ultimately banish their foe.

Sorcery is a realm contested by Avatars with one goal: to be the last Avatar standing. In order to win, a player must first put their opponent’s Avatar at Death’s Door by reducing its life total to 0. After that, the player must then deliver the final Death Blow to the dying Avatar, which rewards them with the win. A player also wins if their opponent attempts to draw a card from an empty deck—either the Atlas or Spellbook— or if their opponent surrenders.

Sorcery: Contested Realm is played over a series of turns. Players take their turn, one at a time, following 3 phases:

Start Phase
Untap Step: Untap your Avatar, minions, and relics.
Draw Step: Draw a card from your Spellbook or Atlas. If you are the first player, skip this step on your first turn of the game.
Start Step: “At the start of turn” abilities trigger.

Main Phase
You may, in any order:
Cast spells; Activate abilities; Interact with relics; Move with a minion; Attack with a minion;

End Phase
Rest Step: Remove damage from all minions.
End Step: “Until the end of turn” abilities end, and the turn passes to your opponent.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Stardust Coffee
boardgame.description:
Story:
the 17th century, Ottoman Turk Empire, one of the most powerful states at that time, marched west to Austria and because of that, Arabs began to bring coffee into Europe. From that moment on, coffee has become one of the most popular drinks in the world. Then hundreds of years have passed, and even though travel between universes has become a daily routine like taking buses, coffee has spread from Earth to different Space Cities, the colonial satellites in outer space. Enjoying a cup of high-quality coffee every day has become the most anticipated thing for residents of Space Cities every day.

After hundreds of years passed, a space expedition led by Dr. Brent Tully discovered an organic material called "Stardust". By adding only a small amount of this magic ingredient, the flavors and aroma of any coffee are greatly enhanced. Moreover, the more freshly picked Stardust, the more it can improve the quality of coffee. This triggered a coffee revolution! In pursuit of the ultimate flavors, many new expeditions have been established on different Space Cities with the goal of "seeking the freshest Stardust and ingredients for the first time and delivering the most delicious coffee". Beside the danger of sailing the spaceship across the galaxy, there is a robber called "Galaxy Pirates", which is more threatening to them...

Game Aim:
In Stardust Coffee, you control a space expedition and sail your spaceships across the Galaxy. You collect different ingredients for coffee making and score by delivering the coffee back to your Starbase. Collecting Stardust and adding them to your coffee is another way to boost your Victory Points (VPs). By upgrading your spaceships, you could also speed up your collection of ingredients or Stardust.
When the game goes on, the Galaxy Pirates will attack your Spaceships and rob your ingredients. By fighting back the Galaxy Pirates, you get Honor points and it will be another source of scoring. Only the player who could manage the Spaceships the best would gain most VPs to win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Foxy
boardgame.description:
In Foxy you’ll put your memory and observation skills to the test in a sequence of full color big sized cards.

You’ll have to pay attention to all the animals that will appear on the revealed card of that round and try to remember how many of the same type you’ve seen up to that moment. How strongly do you trust your memory?

Each round you'll write down a number that, in the scoring phase, will give you as many point... but only if equal to or less than the real number of animals that have appeared up to that moment. Will you play safe or will you play on the edge to maximise your scoring?

boardgame.name: Tindaya: Miniaturen-Box
boardgame.description:
Miniatures Box (Miniaturen-Box) containing the miniatures that are contained in the deluxe editions but not in the retail editions.

The Miniatures Box is available in Spieleschmiede only in combination with the German retail version.

boardgame.name: Unangenehme Gäste: wiederbeschreibbare Bögen
boardgame.description: The German publisher Taverna Ludica Games sells eight double-sided player sheets that are rewritable.

boardgame.name: The Defence of Procyon III: Miniature Upgrade
boardgame.description:
The German Spieleschmiede crowdfunding campaing sold miniatures for:
Aethyn Mothership (1x)
Moon Refineries (1x)
SP Marker Aethyn (1x)
Absorpion Field (4x)
Deflector Shields (6x)
Naharan Artefact (round; 1x)
Energy Converters (3x)
SP Marker Humans (1x)

boardgame.name: Beast: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: The German Spieleschmiede crowdfunding campaign allowed to buy separately 12 metal coins together with a linen cloth bag.

boardgame.name: Aragami 2
boardgame.description:
Aragami 2 is a third person stealth game where you play as an assassin with the power to control the shadows. Join the shadow clan and fight the invader armies to protect your people.

From darkness the Shadow clan has returned
You are one of the last elite warriors of your kin, the Aragami. Victims of a supernatural affliction which corrodes the body and devours the mind, the Aragami control Shadow Essence - a mystical power which grants the ability to control the shadows. With this power the Aragami carry out their tasks and quests - assignments made all along the valley to ensure the subsistence of the village and to free the Aragami enslaved by the invader armies. Aragami 2 is a third person stealth game where you play as an assassin with the power to control the shadows. Join the shadow clan and fight the invader armies to protect your people

Play in single mode or in co-op with your friends
Discover a full campaign and join the assassin squad up to 3 players in co-op.

Engage in fast-paced stealth actions
Manage covers and powers with agility. Take down your enemies with stealth kills and non-lethal takedowns.

Enter into combat as a tactical decision
Become the master of a skill based combat with high risk and high reward.

Build your own shadow assassin
Craft your weapons and armors and upgrade your elite warrior with a wide variety of abilities and shadow powers.

Protect the Rashomon Valley
Save your people and defeat the curse before it ends with you and discover how the Aragami became a legend.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Xbox Series X edition

boardgame.name: Everdell: Berlin Brettspiel Con Promo Card
boardgame.description:
The promo was originally available as part of the Berlin Brettspiel Con support campaign.

Card text:
Draw one card for each other production building in your city or gain one resource for every two other production buildings in your city.

This is an alternate artwork card for Carnival found in Everdell: Collector's Edition/Extra! Extra! expansion.

boardgame.name: Violent Dark
boardgame.description:
Violent Dark (formerly Anomaly) is a 32mm co-op or head-to-head game that pits the crew of a massive corporation’s ship or planetary facility against the threats of the galaxy that lurk and prey beyond The Dark. A game is played with 3-5 miniatures per side on a 2’×2′ area.

Violent Dark can be played as a solo game, a player will have control of four crew models to complete the selected mission against an A.I. driven threat; a multiplayer game allowing each player to activate and choose the destiny of a single or multiple crew models against an A.I. threat; or a One vs Many scenario for someone to play as the Threat itself! One person playing the chosen threat and four players controlling a crew model.

Violent Dark pits four crew against a threat that the players choose before the game begins. The core game provides everything necessary to play the core five missions. Missions are played on a two foot by two foot play area and filled with terrain as well as selected or randomly chosen environmental conditions. Players will also randomly choose a Plan B. These represent sub objectives the players may try to accomplish for minor and moral victories.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Prime Stone
boardgame.description:
"Rainbow ore is a legendary mineral that is more beautiful than any mineral. Many alchemists are trying to figure out how to make Rainbow ore from different minerals. Every day these alchemists have to find the necessary ore. But finding the required ore is not an easy task. They may have to rely on some luck sometimes. Sometimes it may be ore, But sometimes it might get a stone."

Prime Stone is an educational board game designed for classroom use. The game rules are simple enough to develop calculating skills, which are a necessary basis for learning mathematics at a higher level. The prime Stone game can be used to educate about integer factorization and review content such as the greatest common divisor and least common multiple, prime numbers, composite numbers, powers, and other related topics. Teachers can use it to schedule classroom activities and play outside of school hours. Parents can play with their children to help them improve their math skills.

Players can choose to do one of three things: Pick, Mix and Build. Details are as follows: 1) Take two tiles from the bag and place them in front of the player. If the player picks up one stone tile, the player places the picked tile in front and puts the stone tile back into the bag. 2) Combine two or three tiles placed in front of the player using Multiply and put the old and new tiles back into the bag. 3) Create Rainbow ore from the target card. Using two or three tiles placed in front of the player multiplies any number of the target cards. Players can use those two or three tiles to create rainbow ore by having the player put the tile used to create it back into the bag. Then put the target card in front of the player and put the number of stone tiles specified in the target card into another player's bag. (will give stone tiles all with one player or distributed to multiple other players) and then open a new target card to replace it.

There are two conditions to ending the game, either 1) the player generates eight rainbow ore or 2) the player collects four target cards. When one of the players meets the condition, play that round as the last round and count rainbow ore number. The player with the most number of rainbow ore is the winner.

boardgame.name: Stacks
boardgame.description:
Stacks is a fast-playing, abstract tactical game for two players.

The game is played on a 5 x 5 grid (25 spaces in total). Each player gets 10 playing pieces either in red or black. Your pieces start on stacks of 2 on your own home spaces, adjacent to the main playing grid.

In each turn, a player can move one or more of their pieces across the board. The aim of the game is to get four or more of your pieces into the opponent’s home spaces, or to eliminate six or more of the opponent’s pieces.

The game is easy to learn, and is highly re-playable, offering players interesting and difficult tactical and strategic choices.

boardgame.name: The Valley
boardgame.description:
Deep in the hidden wilds of the New Zealand bush, an engineered wilderness is flourishing. After years of intensive, secret research, edible species from Aotearoa and all over the world finally flourish year-round in the Valley, a forager's paradise in a climate-controlled biodome.

You are a Cottager, leading your team of Gatherers to forage for harvest goods, learn your craft from local Artisans, and craft the best recipes to sell to your customers. Move around the modular hex tile Valley, choosing from actions to harvest, make recipes, visit Artisans, complete Goals, and get those sales. Choose recipes from a river of cards that include good and bad event cards - play the standard game or add the Spice cards for increased complexity - but take care, as every card drawn can precipitate Nightfall, the end of the day, where the board resets, the overnight growth cycle restocks the resource tiles, and all Gatherers return to the Cottage with their laden baskets.

The game ends when the Recipe cards run out and the final Night falls. After you have added your Goal points to your recipe card values, the player with the highest score is the winner.

The Valley is very flexible - with 2 to 6 players, and gameplay from 20 minutes to several hours, you can play a quick game by ending the game on the first or second Nightfall card, or play with up to 6 rounds, each ending in a Night. You can also control the complexity by adding in Spicy Recipes, Event cards, Goals, and by using your Cottager abilities.

The Valley is set in New Zealand, so it also features recipe ingredients and cultural terms which only apply in Aotearoa. While these are covered briefly in the Glossary, we encourage you to jump down that rabbithole and learn more about this beautiful country!

boardgame.name: Der Saturnische Kelch
boardgame.description:
(from the back of the book)
In three adventures, the players are confronted with the Cthulhu Mythos in a variety of ways:

The Saturnine Chalice
When asking for help for their broken-down vehicle, the investigators find themselves in the company of a strange homeowner and his mysterious house, where nothing is as it seems. (1920s)

Shadows over Providence
An invitation gathers investigators of all kinds - historians, scholars, black marketeers - in a luxurious hotel in Providence. What dangers await them when given the opportunity to examine the remains of someone known in ancient times as "Ibnhotep the Mad"? (1928, ready-made investigators, particularly suitable for new keepers)

shape 6
Sometimes the biggest threat is amazingly tiny. In Arizona, investigations into various calls for help culminate in a deadly 1960s horror-movie-style menace. (1960s)

boardgame.name: Undertow: The Beach Game
boardgame.description:
It's a fine day at the beach and everyone is out swimming. But the Undertow is pulling you, your family, and friends out to sea! It’s a race to see who can get their family back to the beach safely before they are lost forever…

Undertow - The Beach Game is a quick and fun rainy day game where you roll dice and try to rescue your friends and family before the other players.

During setup players roll a number of dice (determined by how many players) and take turns placing them in the water (the game board) based on the number rolled.

Each turn consists of rolling three turn dice; two for movement and one modifier die. The movement dice determine how many outward and inward moves need to be made by the players swimmers. The modifier die changes these moves including bonuses like "The Big Wave" that allows more inward movement, and "Undertow!" where all movement needs to be outward.
The game ends when any player has moved all their swimmers to the safety of The Beach.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Jaipur: First Player Metal Token
boardgame.description: First metal player token for Jaipur.

boardgame.name: Reavers of Midgard: Tafel der Wiedergeburt
boardgame.description:
Promocard from the Crowdfunding of Support Berlin Con at Spieleschmiede.

Table of Rebirth

Any: Discard this artifact to take one of your Reavers from your Glory Pile and use it as if you recruited it.

Tafel der Wiedergeburt

Beliebig: Wirf dieses Artefakt ab, um 1 Räuberkarte von deinem Ruhmstapel zu nehmen und sie zu verwenden als hättest du sie gerade erst erhalten.

listing.notes:
1. Condition | Erhaltungszustand New. | Neu.
2. Shipping conditions | Versand Shipping costs are postage plus 0.50 Euro for packing. | Versand: Portokosten plus 50 Cent für Verpackung.
3. Payment conditions | Zahlung Payment can be done by bank transfer (my banking account is in Germany) oder by payment via Paypal (buyers are asked to use the friends & family option, otherwise the buyer has to add the paypal fees). | Zahlung per Überweisung oder per Paypal (bitte friends & family Option, ansonsten trägt der Käufer bzw. die Käuferin zusätzlich die Paypal-Gebühr).

boardgame.name: Hal and Roger's Creature Compendium
boardgame.description:
From an ENNIE award winning author comes a collection of over fifty creatures designed for the busy Dungeon Master.

Hal and Roger are intrepid adventurers and explorers who report the creatures they encounter in a monthly column in The Oracle RPG magazine.

They provide the stories behind the creatures and recount their narrow escapes from their jaws/claws/fangs etc!

This print edition collects all their reports from the first year of the magazine and adds in 5e compatible stat blocks for the first time.

And over ten new creatures with new stories are also presented.

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/thegrinningfrog/hal-and...

boardgame.name: Gluty Bear and the Wurst Truck
boardgame.description:
Late evening in the Black Forest. The hungry lumberjacks gather for some grilled wurst. Can the gluten-
intolerant bear steal one? Or will it end up with a bread roll and a belly ache?

Gluty Bear and the Wurst Truck is a mini card game of just 7 cards. The objective is to either eat the wurst being the bear or to eat the wurst and bun as a lumberjack (fork).

Players have just one card on their hands which they repeatedly swap in secret with two cards lying in middle of the table. They try to track where the wurst and everything else is and wait in patience for the right moment to dive in with either bear or fork in order to eat.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ciemna Strona Mydła
boardgame.description:
The game consists in arranging five-word sentences from word cards divided into 5 levels of "sharpness". The players randomly choose one of them and try to dominate the sentence with words with their level. To make it not too easy, word cards have effects that significantly affect the gameplay and allow you to plan your strategies.

Classic variant: 170 cards + instruction.

Deluxe variant: 170 cards + 50 cards from the Pierwsze Namydlenie expansion + instructions.

Every player on their turn add one card to form a sentence and selects a new card on hand. The cards are arranged in the following order: adjective, noun, verb, noun, adverb. On the first card, more are placed, changing the sentence. The meaning of the sentence does not matter, what counts is the markings (numbers) on the cards. The resulting sentences are fun, but just an extra dose. Some cards also have additional functions that make the game easier for their owner or make it difficult for opponents. When someone dominates the sentence with his sign, he wins and the game is over.

boardgame.name: MISSING: An Interactive Thriller
boardgame.description:
MISSING is an episodic series bringing the 90's FMV games and classic adventure together in a unique experience. Use your brain to solve puzzles, find items and use reflexes in action sequences to help the characters progress in the story.

Publisher Blurb

boardgame.name: The Carniverse: Dark Eden
boardgame.description:
Eden has gone dark, but your survival is just beginning. Dark Eden is the 1st major expansion for the Carniverse skirmish game. Within its pages you'll find additions to features that already exist in the game, as well as a host of completely new mechanics to keep you on your toes as you try to fend off the dinosaurs.

This 80+ page PDF is jammed packed with content to give your campaigns new life as you continue your survival in the new world!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Heroes of Qalanor
boardgame.description:
Heroes of Qalanor is a solo/co-op tabletop dungeon crawling adventure game for 1 to 4 players. The game is miniature agnostic.

The land of Qalanor (Kal-an-or) on the planet Threa (Th-ray) is an Island and the largest land mass on the planet. It stretches five thousand miles from the snow capped Karg mountain range in the North to the jungles and deserts of the South and three and a half thousand miles from the rich farming lands in the West to the vibrant sun drenched lands in the East.

Many cultures call Qalanor their home and many races dwell in the cities, towns, villages and wilds. The predominant civilised races are Humans, Elves, Dwarfs and Halflings. Some even band together to form adventuring parties of wizards and warriors skilled with spell, bow and sword.

These adventurers seek fortune and fame, accepting quests to rid the land of monsters plaguing Hamlets and Villages or battling blood thirsty cultists beneath city streets! Wherever there is gold to be made and magic items to be found there will be a Hero of Qalanor ready to quest!

—publisher's description

boardgame.name: Detail
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Detail is a worldbuilding game for 1-5 people. This game facilitates collaboratively building a setting through the use of small Details given significance. Play it as a stand-alone game, or create a setting for other roleplaying games or stories.

Now featuring Detail: Regrowth, an expansion with 60 new details centered on the natural world.

boardgame.name: Detail: Regrowth
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Detail: Regrowth, an expansion with 60 new details centered on the natural world.

Detail is a worldbuilding game for 1-5 people. This game facilitates collaboratively building a setting through the use of small Details given significance. Play it as a stand-alone game, or create a setting for other roleplaying games or stories.

boardgame.name: Hectic Harvest
boardgame.description:
In Hectic Harvest, you are a gardener who is trying to plant a plentiful garden of veggies of five different types, while trying to avoid pesky rabbits that are attracted to your well-tended garden.

Hectic Harvest is a pattern building, tile placement game for all ages that has an intuitive and challenging solo mode, scalable multiplayer and a Super Seed that allows you to break the rules for one turn!

Plan your garden by selecting vegetables that help you create large areas to maximize points. Intelligent planting is key because when rabbits invade your garden, they always have access to half of it. While all players are targeted by the same rabbit, a well placed vegetable can be the difference between winning and losing.

Strategize how your garden is built as you take advantage of important bonuses that reward you for planting a variety of veggies or only 1 type in any row or column.

After selecting vegetables, you move all remaining tokens to the right. This intriguing mechanic allows a vegetable token to change importance by turn.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 5 Paths: A Tactical Brawl
boardgame.description:
A quick and dirty roll move and capture. Each game takes 15-30 minutes on average and you win by being the first to capture 5 of your opponent's pieces or locking them out of the game.

Each player places a combination of 5 archetype pieces on the board (each archetype uses 2d6 in a specific way). Some pieces capture by landing on enemy pieces while others capture at a distance and some even stun and drag enemy pieces.

Every turn follows the same rhythm of a player declaring which piece they intend to use, rolling the dice if appropriate, and then applying that die value to the pieces they selected in order to dominate their opponents or mitigate their risk depending on how the dice came up.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 2400: Legends
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Legends say when the Otherworld threatened the Firmament, The Lord DEUS bade us take up steel and spell, defend the weak, and prove even the lowliest knave could someday be a Legend.

Legends is a super-slim, self-contained RPG about warriors, mages, clerics, and rogues questing in a medieval fantasy world. It's 3 pages and a cover, fitting on two sides of a letter-sized page. It's part of the 2400 series of micro RPGs — lo-fi sci-fi modules that might all be in the same setting, unless they aren't. Check out the free Inner System Blues for a sample, and the free Emergency Rules supplement for additional guidance on combat and pacing for a game without "hit points".

Legends includes minimalist interpretations of classic fantasy spells, rules-light class "talents", and tables for quests, locations, encounters, and treasures.

boardgame.name: Crack It
boardgame.description:
In a City of Thieves, the quickest hand gets the loot. You'll need to use your wits to crack your rivals' safe combination while protecting your own stash. Turn the dial until you hear CLICK! In the end, only one will achieve glory. Will you become the King of Thieves?

Crack It is a game for 2 to 5 players who take on the role of a safecracker and try to figure out the combination of their rivals.

During your turn you can limit a combination number of a rival box and perform as many actions as you want (and have). There are multiple actions. But don't be fooled: any action can be denied by others using ban cards. At the end of your turn, draw again until you complete your hand and pass the turn to the player on your left.

If a rival's third number is revealed, his/her safe is opened and he/she is out of the fight to be the last thief standing.

The game ends when there is only one safe left to be opened. Depending on the chosen game mode, the winner will be the last thief standing or the one with the most prestige points.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Dead Man's Draw: Pirate Token
boardgame.description: Deluxe Starting Player Token for Dead Man's Draw

boardgame.name: Medium: The Psychic Party Game
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Medium.

boardgame.name: Light Hunters: Duel
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Light Hunters.

boardgame.name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Terraplanistas
boardgame.description:
We don't believe in witches, but there are, there are.

Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about popular beliefs, conspiracy theories, superstitions and paranormal events.

boardgame.name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: ¿Vivimos en el Mismo Mundo?
boardgame.description:
Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions designed for you who enjoy being told incredible curiosities, watch a documentary on Discovery and are shocked for weeks and store piles of useless information in your head... And you often wonder how can it be that that and I live in the same planet?

boardgame.name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Millennials
boardgame.description:
Were you born between the 80s and 90s? Did you grow up to Britney's hits and playing Minesweeper on Windows XP?

Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about pop culture, technology from another era, movies, music and much more. Disconnect dial up internet and let's play!

boardgame.name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Nocturna
boardgame.description:
Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about zombies, ghosts, nightmarish creatures and serial killers that have struck fear into the hearts of fans for decades. This expansion is our gift to those who cannot read these sentences without getting chills:
"Here's Johnnyyy!"
"Whatever you do... Don't fall asleep!"
"I see dead people"
"We all go a little crazy, sometimes"

boardgame.name: Space Station Corridors Expansion
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

Hall Pass!

Time to get your hands dirty! Next time your planers need to crawl through the grimy pipes and ducts of a space station, they won't have to wait while you draw every access hatch and control panel. Starfinder Flip-Tiles: Space Station Corridors Expansion provides beautifully illustrated 6" x 6" map tiles that can be used to enhance your game with various claustrophobic corridors found in a space station's maintenance area. Inside you'll find 24 richly crafted, double-sided map tiles. This expansion set, alongside the Starfinder Flip-Tiles: Space Station Starter Set, allows you to create futuristic space habitats with endless variety! So stop your sketching and start flipping today! the Starfinder Flip-Tiles: Space Station Corridors Expansion includes:

Turbine Access
Maintenance Corridors
Trash Compactor
Water Tank
Incinerator

boardgame.name: Casino
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

Double Down on Danger!

Place your bets on high adventure with this double-sided Starfinder Flip-Mat featuring a different far-future casino on each side.! Rub shoulders with the high and mighty at a high-stakes, upper-class gambling palace, or take your chances withing a dark and dingy gambling den. Starfinder Flip-Mats present ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces fort the busy Game Master. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Casino, you'll be ready for the next time your players decide to gamble with their lives!

boardgame.name: Lava World
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

Watch Your Step!

Whether the heroes are surveying a moon dotted with erupting volcanoes or fighting on unstable islands in the middle of an active lava flow, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every volcanic rock outcropping and lava fountain. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Starfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. This double-sided map features a river of lava cascading down a cliff face on one side and a bubbling lava lake filling a crater on the other. Don't waste time sketching when you could be playing. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Lava World, you'll be ready the next time your players discover that the ground is lava!

boardgame.name: Space Colony
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

Set Down Your Roots!

Whether the heroes are investigating the mysterious disappearance of a lost colony's inhabitants or looking to put down their own roots on some distant planet, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every prefab building and power generator. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Starfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. This double-sided map features two newly established colonial settlements. Don't waste time sketching when you could be playing. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Space Colony, you'll be ready the next time your players want to settle a new world!

boardgame.name: Water World
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

All At Sea!

Whether the heroes are exploring an ocean moon or visiting a world flooded after an environmental crisis, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every coral reef and undersea trench. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Starfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. This double-sided map features the surface of a wide expanse of water featuring outcroppings of rock and coral on one side and a stretch of seabed on the other. Don't waste time sketching when you could be playing. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Water World, you'll be ready the next time your players discover they need a bigger boat!

boardgame.name: Serpents in the Cradle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

As the heroes continue to explore their newfound alien world, they discover an ancient monastery deep underground. Exploring this ruin reveals intriguing glimpses at the planet's long history, but as the PCs return to the surface, they find a small Aspis Consortium-connected village established illegally in their territory. When things start going wrong in their own settlement, the PCs must establish whether it is just bad luck or deliberate sabotage on the part of these troublesome newcomers!

“Serpents in the Cradle” is a Starfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for four 3rd-level characters. This adventure continues the Horizons of the Vast Adventure Path, a six-part, bimonthly campaign in which the heroes are at the forefront of exploring and charting a newly discovered world filled with mystery. This volume also includes a look at the shady Aspis Consortium, relics of a philosophy of balance and renewal, and a selection of diverse alien creatures.

Each bimonthly full-color softcover Starfinder Adventure Path volume contains a new installment of a series of interconnected science-fantasy quests that together create a fully developed plot of sweeping scale and epic challenges. Each 64-page volume of the Starfinder Adventure Path also contains in-depth articles that detail and expand the Starfinder campaign setting and provide new rules, a host of exciting new monsters and alien races, a new planet to explore and starship to pilot, and more!

boardgame.name: Whispers of the Eclipse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Answering a call for help from a neighboring group of settlers, the heroes embark on a rescue mission that takes them to a hidden jungle valley, where alien dinosaurs prowl among ancient elven ruins. The trail leads through a magical portal to an abandoned Azlanti base on the world's moon. There, survivors from a scouting mission gone awry huddle in the darkness, hiding from a terrifying, malevolent creature from another plane!

"Whispers of the Eclipse" is a Starfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for four 5th-level characters by Kate Baker. This adventure continues the Horizons of the Vast Adventure Path, a six-part, bimonthly campaign in which the heroes are at the forefront of exploring and charting a newly discovered world filled with mystery. This volume also includes a history of the diaspora of the elves, gear from an ancient spacefaring civilization, and a selection of diverse alien creatures.

Each bi-monthly full-color softcover Starfinder Adventure Path volume contains a new installment of a series of interconnected science-fantasy quests that together create a fully developed plot of sweeping scale and epic challenges. Each 64-page volume of the Starfinder Adventure Path also contains in-depth articles that detail and expand the Starfinder campaign setting and provide new rules, a host of exciting new monsters and alien races, a new planet to explore and starship to pilot, and more!

boardgame.name: Icebound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

A distress beacon from a desolate section of tundra sends the heroes on a rescue mission in the biting cold. They find a lone vesk survivor in the wreckage of a starship prowled by a menacing insectile stowaway: a component of the dreaded Swarm! The heroes trace the creature's origin to a frozen gas giant in the same system, where a mutated Swarm colony has begun to awaken from a strange hibernation. Will the heroes brave the floating organic lair to stop the Swarm from contacting the greater hive mind?

"Icebound" is a Starfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for four 7th-level characters by Jason Tondro. This adventure continues the Horizons of the Vast Adventure Path, a six-part, bimonthly campaign in which the heroes are at the forefront of exploring and charting a newly discovered world filled with mystery. This volume also includes a dossier on the Veskarium spy agency known as Directive-9, technology repurposed from the Swarm, and a selection of deadly alien threats.

Each bi-monthly full-color softcover Starfinder Adventure Path volume contains a new installment of a series of interconnected science-fantasy quests that together create a fully developed plot of sweeping scale and epic challenges. Each 64-page volume of the Starfinder Adventure Path also contains in-depth articles that detail and expand the Starfinder campaign setting and provide new rules, a host of exciting new monsters and alien races, a new planet to explore and starship to pilot, and more!

boardgame.name: Allies Against the Eye
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Heralds of an organization called The Order of the Culling Shadow announce their presence, proclaiming the eventual destruction of every thinking being in the system. The PCs must spread the terrible news to New Harmony's other charters, as well as reach out to the Pact Worlds and the Veskarium for assistance. Can the heroes navigate political complications and face strange dangers to gain the cooperation of possible allies, or will they go alone into what could possibly be an all-out war?

"Allies Against the Eye" is a Starfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for four 9th-level characters by Jabari Weathers. This adventure continues the Horizons of the Vast Adventure Path, a six-part, bimonthly campaign in which the heroes are at the forefront of exploring and charting a frontier world filled with mystery. This volume also includes an examination against the dangerous cult called The Order of the Culling Shadow, paths to mystical enlightenment, and a selection of unusual alien threats.

Each bi-monthly full-color softcover Starfinder Adventure Path volume contains a new installment of a series of interconnected science-fantasy quests that together create a fully developed plot of sweeping scale and epic challenges. Each 64-page volume of the Starfinder Adventure Path also contains in-depth articles that detail and expand the Starfinder campaign setting and provide new rules, a host of exciting new monsters and alien races, a new planet to explore and starship to pilot, and more!

boardgame.name: It's a Wonderful Kingdom: Promo Pack
Egy szép új királyság promó kártyák
boardgame.description:
5 promo cards/Promo kaarten (5 kaarten) with images and no text.

2x Steengroeve / Stone quarry

1x Huurlingen / Mercenaries

1x Paleis / Palace

1x Doolhof van Fenhror / Maze of Fenhror

boardgame.name: Mid-Life Crisis: Helpline!
boardgame.description:
Players are divided into counselors and a caller, and the caller changes every round.

As a counselor, race to to piece together advice from the words scattered in front of you in a humorous attempt to solve the caller's problem.

The caller picks their favorite response.

For 3-4 players, the first player to be awarded five cards wins. For more than five players, the first player to be awarded three cards wins.

boardgame.name: Sabacc: Coruscant Shift
boardgame.description:
This format of Sabacc is sold exclusively aboard the Star Wars: Galactic Starcruiser at Disney's Hollywood Studios. It uses different components and slightly different rules than the version sold in Blackspire Outpost. Like "Corellian Spike" Sabaac, the deck includes 30 green positive cards with values of 1 through 10 (3 each), 30 red negative cards with values of -1 through -10 (3 each), and two black cards with values of 0. However, unlike that version, there are also two custom dice, one which shows suits (square, circle, triangle) and one which shows a number value (0,0,5,-5,10,-10).

The object of the game is to score as close as possible to the number rolled on the gold die. The silver suit die is used as a tie breaker if two players have the same value. Suit values are per card, so two triangle cards would be two triangles, no matter what the value of the card shows.

Once the dealer has rolled the dice, he deals five cards to each player. Players then calculate their hands, and save as many cards as they would like face down. Then the "Shift" phase occurs, which allows players to get new cards for cards they did not save, returning their hands to 5 cards. The "Improve" step is adding newly acquired cards to their face down saved cards pile, if they wish. The improve cards may alternatively be discarded. Finally, players "Reveal" their face down cards to see who came closest to the dice value goal.

Betting chips are not included in the game, but a round of betting after the deal, "Shift" and "Improve" phases is assumed. This is also how game play works in the electronic Sabacc table version you can play in the Sublight Lounge on the Galactic Starcruiser. Once all players have had a chance to deal, the game ends and the player with the most betting chips wins.

"Coruscant Shift" has also removed the hand ranking complexity of "Corellian Spike". If two or more players have equal hands, even after the suits tie breaker, players split the pot.

There is also a Sabacc: Bounty Hunt variant included in the rules, which is similar to Go Fish for younger children.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Star Wars: Han Solo Card Game

boardgame.name: Fairy Tale Files: Sweet Witch Inferno
boardgame.description:
Fairy Land's most popular candy shop was burnt to the ground and the proprieter was found under the rubble, incinerated in the oven! Who could do such a thing? The main suspects, Hansel & Gretel, were seen at the scene of the crime but what could their motive be for such a heinous crime?

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Hansel and Gretel

boardgame.name: Traff Park
boardgame.description:
This is a game based on the similarly named Hungarian browser Flash game. It can be found at "traff.hu", but unfortunately it has not worked since Flash Player was discontinued in 2020.

This game, like the website and books published over the years, teaches children how to drive safely on the roads.

In this game, players must be the first to get their car home after going through each station in the four corners of the game board. They roll a dice in each round to determine how much they can advance on the board by following the traffic rules. The game is hampered by certain events, such as puddles or roadblocks.

The first player to get home to the garage after washing their car, charging their battery, inflating their tires and refueling their car wins the game.

boardgame.name: Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest – 54 Metal Doubloon Coins
boardgame.description: These 54 thick metal doubloon coins were designed specifically for Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest (the game includes cardboard coins). There are 24 copper-colored $1 coins, 18 silver-colored $3 coins, and 12 gold-colored $5 coins, each with the same image on both sides. These coins are only available on the Stonemaier Games webstore, not from retailers.

boardgame.name: Dyson's Delve: Dungeon Geomorphs
boardgame.description:
User summary:
A set of 153 square tiles that can be used to create random dungeon and cavern maps, all drawn in the distinctive Dyson Logos style.

boardgame.name: Oath: Chronicles of Empire and Exile – Tower Rex Organizer
boardgame.description:
The time to rise has come. For too long the exiles have roamed the outskirts of the empire. Will you protect the Empire and keep the old oaths, or will you be the one to tear it down? TowerRex will help you either way and present an organizer for the Oath board game.

The organizer comprises of:
- Grand cardholder for all types of cards with named dividers;
- Two trays for all the funds' cubes;
- Six trays for each corresponding player's tokens;
- Tray for all the KS coins and secrets;
- Tray for the coins, secrets, round and faction markers;
- Tray for the relics and oaths;
- Dice-Castle for all the battle and defense cubes;
- Set of special achievements from TowerRex.

The organizer supports:
- KS Upgrades;
- Sleeves of thickness 40-50 (UltrPro, MayDay, etc.);
- All the promo cards.

One organizer to hold them all!

Important point! Check the sizing of your box before purchasing the organizer to avoid mismatching with printings and editions.
Organizer's sizing:
Length - 390mm / 15.35"
Width - 198mm / 7.80"
Height - 57mm / 2.24"
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Oath: Chronicles of Empire and Exile

boardgame.name: Dune: Tower Rex Organizer
boardgame.description:
TowerRex presents an organizer for the Dune. Here's a quick rundown of what is it:

Compatible with:
- Ixians and Tleilaxu;
- Promos;
- Goodies and Upgrades;
- It is compatible with sleeved cards of MayDay, UltraPro, etc. Recommended thickness is 60-70 microns.

The organizer includes:
- 8 Engraved player boards;
- Cardholder for the treachery cards;
- Cardholder for all the faction, sandstorm, traitor and spice blow cards;
- Tray for all the spice of the desert;
- Tray for the special tokens and upgrades;

Important point! Check the sizing of your box before purchasing the organizer to avoid mismatching with printings and editions.

Organizer's sizing:
Length - 247mm / 9.72"
Width - 247mm / 9.72"
Height - 48mm / 1.89"

boardgame.name: KTA: Steal that car!
boardgame.description:
Steal the cars, escape then police chasing, crash and shoot your competition to earn big cash! In this game each player takes a role of car burglar in the city where no car is safe.

The game contains two packs of cards (cars and missions), tokens (police, pistol, speed and damage), dice and figures of thieves. Game is released under Creative Commons license and is available for download, print and play.

Each player start with three random secret missions. During each player's turn one of following action can be performed: scouting (exploring) cars, stealing them, arm with firearms, ride and/or crash, shoot and accomplish a mission.

Violent actions can trigger police chasing of different levels which has to be avoided at the start of the turn by dice rolling.

First player who manage to accomplish missions worth $21.000 wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Motorcycle Mechanic Simulator 2021
boardgame.description: Become the head of a motorcycle mechanic empire in this realistic simulation game. Start from the small garage, upgrade, and buy bigger with new possibilities. Take orders from customers, find old bikes, and give them a new life.

boardgame.name: Atlantic Records
boardgame.description:
A roll-and-move race from Great Britain to the United States from the golden age of parlour board games: the early 20th century.

Players are assigned a starting port and a finish port by taking a mock 'ticket'; they then proceed across the board by rolling the six-sided dice and resolving any effects of special spaces they land upon.

The board offers multiple tracks from each port. Events spaces are noted in 2 letter Morse Code abbreviations.

The first player to reach their designated destination is declared the winner!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Out of Reach: Treasure Royale
boardgame.description:
Treasure Royale is a Battle Royale style game in which dozens of pirate crews face each other on the open sea, jungle islands and dark caves. Navigate your ship, bombard enemies, find gear but above all - hunt treasures!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Delta-V: Rings of Saturn
boardgame.description:
A physics-based mining sim, set in the thickest debris field in Sol. Every action has a reaction, lasers are invisible without a medium, and your thrust is a potent weapon. Find trade, adapt your equipment to your playstyle, hire a crew to help. Unravel the mysteries of the rings, or just get rich.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Good Boy
boardgame.description:
In the game Good Boy you move to the world of cheerful dogs. Here you will meet the most different breeds from around the world.

Your task is to collect toys and treats that will make dogs want to play with you. Beware, however, of devious cats that can spoil even the best fun.

The player who proves to be the dogs' best friend wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

W grze Good Boy przenosicie się do świata wesołych psiaków. Spotkacie tutaj najróżniejsze rasy z całego świata.

Wasze zadanie polega na zbieraniu zabawek i łakoci, dzięki którym psy będą chciały się z Wami bawić. Uważajcie jednak na przebiegłe koty, które mogą popsuć nawet najlepszą zabawę.

Gracz, który okaże się największym przyjacielem psiaków, wygrywa grę.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Magnate: The Boardgame Economy Promo
boardgame.description:
Promo created to celebrate the retail launch in Feb 2022 features a unique set of 4 new tenant cards and 8 corresponding tenant tokens with a special boardgame theme.

Tenants: Game Cafe, Game Distributor, Indie Game Publisher, Boardgamer

boardgame.name: Pawnbarian
boardgame.description:
Pawnbarian is a puzzle roguelike with chess, cards, and tentacle monsters.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Necroworm
boardgame.description:
Chew your way through 120 levels of addictive puzzle gameplay, where your only goal is to devour everything but your own wormy self. It's quick, tasty, and hard to resist. Just like a late-night snack.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Roarr! The Adventures of Rampage Rex
boardgame.description:
An arcade game with a co-op mode in which an angry female T-Rex must defeat space invaders. Stylish, cartoon, polygonal graphics and murderous opponents from the universe - this is just a real Jurassic adventure!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Corridor Z
boardgame.description:
Ordinary high school, zombie outbreak, and the bunch of survivors in a run for life. This time you don’t 'face’ the obstacles, but the actual pursuit. Don’t let the zombies catch you up, throw them the obstacles and aim for the head before they take the first bite. In the meantime find the lost recordings of the audio log and reveal where did the infection come from in your small town. Be quick or be undead!


Experience the most genre refreshing runner in years
Get thrilled with the unique and intense gameplay
Help the pom-pom girl, the jock, and the jarhead to survive
Discover the infection’s mystery with voice-overed story
Stock the awesome upgradeable arsenal: pistols, SMGs, shotguns, and more
Immerse yourself in multiple objectives designed for each of the characters
shoot down tons of running horror!


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The USB Stick Found in the Grass
boardgame.description:
It is a bit difficult to classify The USB Stick Found in the Grass as a game; it is more of a combination of a literary work and a forensic puzzle. If you liked A Normal Lost Phone or Her Story, you will probably like TUSFitG. You are given a virtual representation of a USB stick that was found at a scene of a possible crime and you play a police officer trying to solve a case with very limited information. You are not given any tools to do so, but you can use any tools you have on your computer. The USB Stick Found in the Grass is not subject to any intrinsic limitations on which the game is built. Quite the opposite: TUSFitG is as close to the real thing as possible. The USB drive you will be investigating is indistinguishable from a real one. The tools you will be using are real. If something looks like it can be checked, it can be checked. If something can't be checked, it wasn't our intention – it’s simply the result of a built-in technological limitation. Your job is to find what it is all about, if the stick is in any way related to what have happened and IF anything happened.

And remember: sometimes it is the journey that is more important than the destination!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Crime Zoom: Fenêtre sur crimes
boardgame.description:
Crime Zoom is a series of investigation game for 1 and more players and for plays of about 1 hour.

Each investigation propels you into a different universe, but almost always on a crime scene.

This crime scene is spread over several cards to form a great illustration. To investigate, nothing more simple. Take a card to take a closer look. An item intrigues you? Flip the card over and find out what is this little paper on the bedside table.

An address? You can now take the card that corresponds to this track. Unless another element on the crime scene appeals you even more ?

In Crime Zoom, you will conduct your investigation freely. Discuss between players to choose the tracks to follow. And as soon as you think you have solved the case, go to the questionnaire. Who is guilty ? What is his mobile ? What is the murder weapon ? And some subsidiary questions, of course.

Do not miss the culprit otherwise you will lose the game. But if you answer the questions correctly, the number of cards you will not reveal will decide you.

The solution will answer each of the questions. The epilogue will come to tell all this in a story or a testimony history to understand the plot that has been played.

Crime Zoom: Fenêtre sur crimes is the fifth case of the Crime Zoom family. It brings you in a residence in Los Angeles in 1954. This case is a tribute to Hitchcock famous movie Fenêtre sur cour (Rear Window).

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Orbital Racer
boardgame.description:
A unique combination of space and racing sims. Choose between fast-paced, explosive action or more realistic simulation where drifting around every corner becomes more than just a gimmick – it’s a necessity. Race around distinct locations such as the rings of Saturn or orbital city on Venus.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Pop-A-Tops: Match-A-Martian
boardgame.description:
Pop into the fun with Pop-A-Tops Match-A-Martian! “Roll” the dice and try to be the first one to spot the matching alien card! With Pop-A-Tops, everything fits neatly inside the container, with the dice included in the domed top. Never drop your dice again with them safely contained! Have fun giving the container a pop! to see what you roll!

—description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the dice which show the shape, background and color of the Martian. The first player to grab the corresponding card keeps it. The first player to grab 5th or 7th card (depending on number of players) wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: My Island
boardgame.description:
Modeled after 2020's My City, My Island is a competitive legacy game in which you develop your own unique island from connected hexagons.

Over 24 games, you will experience the history of your island and discover its secrets, with each of the individual games featuring new rules and game materials with which you will permanently change your island.

boardgame.name: Endangered: Ukrainian Ambassador Card
boardgame.description: Endangered: Ukrainian Ambassador Card is a micro-expansion for the base game. The extension introduces a new ambassador card representing Ukraine and specifies a new equation to make that ambassador's vote favorable.

boardgame.name: Steamwatchers: Neoprene Mat
boardgame.description:
This Deluxe stitched Neoprene mat serves to gives players a more comfortable experience. It is 72x108 cm, which is 40% bigger than the cardboard playing mat from the core game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Floating Tower from Atlantis
boardgame.description:
An entry in the Tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

When Atlantis began to sink, the wizard Oulvert invoked powerful magics to teleport his tower to a place of safety elsewhere on Earth. However, inaccuracies in the spellcasting combined with the destructive energies of the cataclysm resulted in an unforeseeable conjuncture. The three topmost levels of the tower were swept away on the tides of Chaos, and Oulvert found his home floating on the desolate seas of another dimension. As the years went by, the hands of Fate continued to pluck the tower from one world and deposit it in another, always placing it on a large body of water far from land.

Now Oulvert’s tower has appeared in your campaign world...

boardgame.name: Hunch!
boardgame.description:
Hunch is all about words! You try to get the others to guess your secret words by cleverly using clues. But beware: you can't think up these clues yourself, you have to buy them from the others.

Be creative and think of the most desirable clues! Be empathetic and buy the right clues! And in the end, have the right hunch when guessing the secret words of your fellow players.

The game is played in three rounds of three phases: creating clues, selling/buying the clues, and guessing the secret words. Victory points are awarded to players who guess correctly and to the players owning the guessed words.

At the end of the three rounds, whoever has the most VP wins (remaining money being the tie-breaker).
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 8
boardgame.description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine delivers tales of tragedy and triumph amid the struggles of BattleMechs on the battlefields of the 31st century and beyond! A spurned Solaris gladiator enacts a unique brand of payback. A Federated Suns mission to take down the infamous “Lady Death” Trevaline runs afoul of pirate ingenuity. A ex-mercenary on Outreach must risk everything during the Fourth Succession War to protect those who cannot protect themselves. In this issue, you’ll venture into the jungles and avoid native predators while racing to recover lost Star League-era data; discover the truth lurking behind a seemingly unbeatable Word of Blake ’Mech; and fight to preserve a MechWarrior’s right to crack open a cold, frosty beverage after the battle is done. Then return to the shadows and danger of the Game World with the penultimate part of our Solaris VII serial.

Contains Rules for:

TRO Executioner B
Unit Digest - First Augustine Arquebusiers
Campaign - A Short Stop in Astrokazy
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG
